HTML:
This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.

Applicants in the County of Los Angeles: Qualified applications with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: New York, NY, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA.Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics.
  • 4 years of experience in SQL and Data Visualization (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, or similar technologies).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with analytical methodologies, including regression, classification, prediction, machine learning, and neural networks.
  • Experience working with Salesforce or other CRM systems.
  • Experience in statistical tools such as R, Python, or similar software.
  • Ability to generate insights from data sets and present them to clients with takeaways.
  • Excellent presentation and verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate compelling data narratives to audiences.
  • Passion for developing and analyzing data sets and translating them into insights that drive business decisions at all levels of the organization.

About The Job

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst for the Exchange Platforms business, you will be responsible for developing insights that guide business leaders to make decisions. You will develop reporting that helps the global sales team quantify the impact of their actions at all levels. You will maintain and grow media sales pipeline reporting activities, working with Salesforce and business growth datasets across the various cuts of the pipeline (e.g., region, agency, advertiser, etc.). You will partner with other BI Analysts to develop data infrastructure and dashboards to drive automated and scaled global reporting on the trends driving the business forward.

The Global Partnerships organization is responsible for exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Google’s Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The Global Partnerships team supports Google’s own Product teams with essential partnerships to help Google’s user experiences in advertising, Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping, Payments and more. Teams create product-enabling partnerships, go-to-market strategies and incubate business growth for a variety of products.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $117,000-$167,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities

  • Analyze data, partner with business leadership to identify new opportunities, and support decision making by providing insights and analysis to business leadership.
  • Develop detailed sales pipeline reporting for executive, manager, and individual contributor audiences using data.
  • Build models and forecasts combining data inputs from databases to estimate the business growth uplift associated with business actions.
  • Partner with the tools team maintaining to prioritize new additions to the data logged for analysis.
  • Develop and maintain accurate, durable, and scalable data pipelines, dashboards and infrastructure to empower exchange stakeholders to self-serve answers questions.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Analyst, Recruiting Analytics
Description:
About Anthropic

Anthropic’s mission is to create reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. We want AI to be safe and beneficial for our users and for society as a whole. Our team is a quickly growing group of committed researchers, engineers, policy experts, and business leaders working together to build beneficial AI systems.

About The Role

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our Recruiting Analytics team at Anthropic. In this role, you will transform data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across our rapidly growing organization. You'll work closely with leadership and cross-functional teams to identify trends, measure performance, and optimize our people practices as we scale our mission-critical work in AI safety.

As a key member of our data-driven culture, you'll help ensure that our talent strategies are grounded in evidence and aligned with our goal of building reliable, interpretable, and steerable AI systems. This role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on how we attract, develop, and retain the exceptional talent needed to advance AI safety.

Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Insights


Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities across the employee lifecycle
Conduct rigorous statistical analysis to support evidence-based decision-making for talent management initiatives
Perform root cause analysis on people-related metrics to understand underlying drivers of organizational outcomes
Design and execute research projects that advance our understanding of what drives employee success and satisfaction


Visualization & Communication


Come up with creative solutions to displaying data (going beyond the traditional dashboard, leveraging AI etc.)
At the same time, create and maintain interactive dashboards and visualizations that help communicate complex data insights to key stakeholders
Translate complex data analyses into clear, compelling narratives for both technical and non-technical audiences
Convert insights into actionable recommendations and drive implementation of solutions
Collaborate with company leaders to identify, track, and iterate key performance indicators (KPIs) for talent management


Cross-Functional Partnerships


Partner with stakeholders to define and scope people analytics projects that align with organizational goals
Work directly with executives to understand business challenges and translate them into technical solutions
Advise on best practices for integrating and analyzing data from various HR systems (e.g., Workday, ATS, surveys) and external sources
Take ownership of diverse responsibilities from research projects to operational process implementation, root cause analysis, and program management


Data Infrastructure & Operations


Model downstream tables for custom reporting and analytics.
Ensure data quality and integrity across recruiting analytics systems and processes
Develop and maintain automated reporting solutions that scale with organizational growth
Collaborate with engineering teams to improve data collection and storage practices


You May Be a Good Fit If You


Have 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably with recruiting analytics, people analytics, or related fields
Have additional experience in people operations or recruiting.
Are proficient in SQL and experienced with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Looker Studio, Power BI)
Are comfortable working with messy or incomplete data
Have strong statistical analysis skills and experience with programming languages such as Python or R
Possess excellent communication skills and can translate complex analytical findings into actionable business insights
Are results-oriented with a bias towards flexibility and impact
Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and enjoy working closely with cross-functional teams
Have experience working with HRIS systems and people data
Care about ensuring that advanced AI systems are developed safely and are passionate about our mission


Strong Candidates May Also Have


Advanced degree in Statistics, Data Science, Psychology, Economics, or related quantitative field
Experience with A/B testing and experimental design
Previous experience in high-growth technology companies or startups
Familiarity with data privacy regulations and ethical considerations in people analytics
Experience with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, GCP) and modern data stack tools


Representative Projects


Modeling data and building dashboards to drive better decision making around Interviewer training and deeper understanding of interviewer capacity & capacity constraints.
Conducting research on the effectiveness of our hiring processes and recommending improvements to reduce bias and improve candidate experience
Collaborate with our compensation team to developing data-driven compensation analysis to ensure pay equity and market competitiveness
Work with recruiting leaders to help them report to the business on basic recruiting metrics, hiring predictions, and opportunities for improvement.


Annual Salary

The expected salary range for this position is:

$160,000 - $205,000 USD

Logistics

Education requirements: We require at least a Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience.

Location-based hybrid policy: Currently, we expect all staff to be in one of our offices at least 25% of the time. However, some roles may require more time in our offices.

Visa sponsorship: We do sponsor visas! However, we aren't able to successfully sponsor visas for every role and every candidate. But if we make you an offer, we will make every reasonable effort to get you a visa, and we retain an immigration lawyer to help with this.

We encourage you to apply even if you do not believe you meet every single qualification. Not all strong candidates will meet every single qualification as listed. Research shows that people who identify as being from underrepresented groups are more prone to experiencing imposter syndrome and doubting the strength of their candidacy, so we urge you not to exclude yourself prematurely and to submit an application if you're interested in this work. We think AI systems like the ones we're building have enormous social and ethical implications. We think this makes representation even more important, and we strive to include a range of diverse perspectives on our team.

How We're Different

We believe that the highest-impact AI research will be big science. At Anthropic we work as a single cohesive team on just a few large-scale research efforts. And we value impact — advancing our long-term goals of steerable, trustworthy AI — rather than work on smaller and more specific puzzles. We view AI research as an empirical science, which has as much in common with physics and biology as with traditional efforts in computer science. We're an extremely collaborative group, and we host frequent research discussions to ensure that we are pursuing the highest-impact work at any given time. As such, we greatly value communication skills.

The easiest way to understand our research directions is to read our recent research. This research continues many of the directions our team worked on prior to Anthropic, including: GPT-3, Circuit-Based Interpretability, Multimodal Neurons, Scaling Laws, AI & Compute, Concrete Problems in AI Safety, and Learning from Human Preferences.

Come work with us!

Anthropic is a public benefit corporation headquartered in San Francisco. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, optional equity donation matching, generous vacation and parental leave, flexible working hours, and a lovely office space in which to collaborate with colleagues. Guidance on Candidates' AI Usage: Learn about our policy for using AI in our application process

Title: Scaled Abuse Analyst
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
1 year of experience in data management, metrics analysis, experiment design and automation.
Experience with classification systems, ranking systems, or similar.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience in SQL, MySQL etc, including identifying trends, generating summary statistics, and drawing insights from quantitative and qualitative data.
Experience in data analysis and statistical modeling.
Experience with fraud and abuse dynamics in online platforms.


About The Job

YouTube’s Trust and Safety team is dedicated to make YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust and Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun and we do it all together.

As a Scaled Abuse Analyst, you are passionate about technologies and have experience analyzing data and scaled systems of review. You will grow in a changing, dynamic, and demanding environment where no two days are ever the same. You will be a key contributor and critical thinker with sound judgment regarding metrics, possessing a passion for coaching others, solving technological tests, and setting scalable standards.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $105,000-$151,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities


Apply advanced statistical methods to large, complex data sets to understand the impact of abuse on the YouTube ecosystem. Provide data-driven insights and recommendations for effective abuse prevention and enforcement.
Learn complex and technical concepts and systems, and deliver meaningful results using them. Communicate technical results and methods clearly.
Identify product vulnerabilities and abuse trends by performing investigations using various data sources. Contribute to the strategy and development of new workflows against additional known vectors of abuse.
Collaborate closely with stakeholders and partners in engineering, product, policy, and legal to drive complex anti-abuse solutions involving and impacting various cross-functional areas.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company

World is a network of real humans, built on privacy-preserving proof-of-human technology, and powered by a globally inclusive financial network that enables the free flow of digital assets for all. It is built to connect, empower, and be owned by everyone.

About The Team

The Data Science team is responsible for providing business intelligence services to the whole project and for deriving data-driven insights to support World’s key decisions. Because of our unique growth model of using a global network of Orb Operators to verify individuals’ unique humanness, we require a high-performing Data Science team that is able to manage and analyze large amounts of data generated by our products and operations. World’s privacy-maximizing approach imposes unique restrictions on how data is collected, stored, and used, making data science innovations critical to derive useful insights. We have earned a reputation for our technical expertise, hands-on approach, responsiveness, precision, and impactful solutions.

About The Opportunity

As the first Data Analyst on the Data Science team, you will be instrumental in generating insights that inform decisions across all departments and domains—ranging from product performance and operational monitoring to logistics and customer support optimization. This role has a strong focus on Business Intelligence, as both the Data Science team and its stakeholders rely heavily on high-quality reporting and data visualizations to drive key decisions in a fast-paced environment. In addition to working closely with the Data Science team, you will collaborate with teams across the broader Data Science & Economics group, including Economic Operations, Fraud & Risk Analytics and Data Engineering. You will report to the Director of Data Science. Your work will directly shape the quality and speed of data-driven decision-making at World.

In This Role, You Will


Contribute to the business intelligence efforts of the Data Science team
Create data models, charts, dashboards, alerts and reports for all departments across the company
Collaborate closely with a high-performing team of data scientists, statisticians, economists and data engineers
Work with an exciting, massive dataset, including Product data (e.g., user in-app behavior, notifications, experiments), blockchain transactions, operations data, and customer support data.
Work in a data-driven and scientific environment where every key decision is supported by thorough data analysis


About You


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field like economics, computer science, statistics, or similar
4+ years of hands-on work experience as a data analyst
Extensive experience in Business Intelligence, in particular in data visualization
Passionate about high-quality data visualizations that are easily accessible to


non-experts and maintained with rigorous attention to detail


Extensive experience with SQL; knowledge of DBT is a plus.
Programming experience in at least one high-level programming language (e.g., Python)
Experience with BI tools like Metabase, Tableau, Looker, or PowerBI
Good understanding of business economics and financial concepts; prior experience working with economic or financial data a plus
High curiosity, strong autonomy, and a deep sense of ownership
Practically oriented and “getting-the-job-done” mindset
Thriving in a fast-paced and continuously evolving environment; experience in start-ups is a plus


Location:

Onsite in San Francisco

Title: Dataiku Data Analyst - AI/ML
Description:
Job Title: Dataiku Data Analyst

Location: Oakland, CA 94612

Duration: 3 Months - Contract to Hire




Job Description:

This role is critical to advancing enterprise-wide analytics at Client.
The Expert Technical Specialist will partner closely with data architecture, data engineering, and business analytics teams to identify and implement machine learning (ML) use cases that address real-world business challenges.
The position sits within Client Data & Analytics Center of Excellence, which is responsible for executing the companys
Enterprise Data & Analytics strategyfostering a data-driven culture, governing data assets, and enabling impactful business insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Leverage deep expertise in Dataiku (and Azure ML) to support business data scientists in defining, developing, tuning, and deploying ML models.
Provide guidance and mentorship to data scientists and development teams on ML best practices from ideation to deployment.
Serve as an Advanced Analytics Product Owner: identify and prioritize new ML use cases, track progress and risks, and coordinate resolution efforts.
Drive thought leadership on Advanced Analytics governance, including ethical and legal guidelines.
Build, validate, and implement predictive models in support of strategic initiatives or AI/ML proof-of-concepts; clearly present findings to stakeholders.
Analyze current data-related processes and lead process improvement initiatives.




Skills/Experience:

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree with 7+ years of relevant experience.




Required Skills and Abilities:

Proven ability to lead complex technical projects and collaborate across all levels of IT and business.
Strong project leadership and organizational skills, with experience delivering high-impact technical solutions.
Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
·Expertise in developing and delivering training or mentorship to team members.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and documentation skills.
Experience developing business cases, proposals, and presentations.

  • Bachelor's degree with 7+ years of relevant experience.


Required Skills and Abilities:

  • Proven ability to lead complex technical projects and collaborate across all levels of IT and business.
  • Strong project leadership and organizational skills, with experience delivering high-impact technical solutions.
  • Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • ·Expertise in developing and delivering training or mentorship to team members.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and documentation skills.
  • Experience developing business cases, proposals, and presentations.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Nimble is a healthtech company on a mission to simplify access, understanding and management of healthcare. We are starting by building the largest, most loved pharmacy business in the world. We are a fast-growing, technology-first startup driven by perfecting the patient and pharmacist experience. Nimble fosters a culture of collaboration, open communication and deliberate action that allows us to face today’s most exciting challenges head-on and grow incredibly quickly.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will act as a core driver for projects spanning across all parts of the business. Data is a key component to how every function operates, and as a resident data expert/coach for your stakeholders, you will empower others to make data-driven decisions through analyses, insights, and setting a precedent for how data is used throughout the company.

You will:


Drive key business and product initiatives through actionable insights
Own data analysis and visualization across the business
Coach non-technical functions to leverage data for their goals
Design data structures (events, tables, etc) that are efficient, logical, and forward-thinking
Mentor junior data analysts
Help create and maintain sustainable processes and practices for data usage across the company




What you bring:


Bachelor's Degree in business / economics, STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics / statistics), or similar fields
3+ years of data analytics experience
Advanced experience with SQL
Proficient in other languages/tools (i.e. R, Python, Excel, etc.)
Excellent communication and storytelling skills for both technical and nontechnical collaboration
Strong foundation in prioritization and stakeholder management
Nice to have: experience with Kibana/Elasticsearch




About you:


You feel a strong sense of ownership over your work
You have a bias for action and driving teams towards concrete goals
You value mentorship and seek to better your teammates and yourself
You have conviction in your decisions, but are ready and willing to listen to diverse perspectives




What's in it for you:


Compassionate and driven colleagues in a fun environment where success is celebrated
Direct access to executives and a transparent company culture
Rare opportunity to change an industry and lives of millions
We are reinventing healthcare / pharmacy - your (grand)parents and your (grand)children will understand and appreciate what you do
Medical / Dental / Vision / 401K package that fits your needs
Generous Vacation Policy - 15 days of paid vacation in the first year, then increases to 20 days after one year
11 Paid Holidays
Work out of our HQ in beautiful downtown Redwood City




At Nimble, we are dedicated to putting patients first and improving pharmacies across America. Join us on this exciting journey!

Diversity, inclusion and belonging at Nimble: Nimble is building a diverse and inclusive work environment where we learn from each other. We pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of diverse backgrounds, abilities and perspectives.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Based in San Francisco, Arine is a rapidly growing healthcare technology and clinical services company with a mission to ensure individuals receive the safest and most effective treatments for their unique and evolving healthcare needs.

Frequently, medications cause more harm than good. Incorrect drugs and doses costs the US healthcare system over $528 billion in waste, avoidable harm, and hospitalizations each year. Arine is redefining what excellent healthcare looks like by solving these issues through our software platform (SaaS). We combine cutting edge data science, machine learning, AI, and deep clinical expertise to introduce a patient-centric view to medication management, and develop and deliver personalized care plans on a massive scale for patients and their care teams.

Arine is committed to improving the lives and health of complex patients that have an outsized impact on healthcare costs and have traditionally been difficult to identify and address. These patients face numerous challenges including complicated prescribing issues across multiple medications and providers, medication challenges with many chronic diseases, and patient issues with access to care. Backed by leading healthcare investors and collaborating with top healthcare organizations and providers, we deliver recommendations and facilitate clinical interventions that lead to significant, measurable health improvements for patients and cost savings for customers.

Why is Arine a Great Place to Work?:

Outstanding Team and Culture - Our shared mission unites and motivates us to do our best work. We have a relentless passion and commitment to the innovation required to be the market leader in medication intelligence.

Making a Proven Difference in Healthcare - We are saving patient lives, and enabling individuals to experience improved health outcomes, including significant reductions in hospitalizations and cost of care.

Market Opportunity - Arine is backed by leading healthcare investors and was founded to tackle one of the largest healthcare problems today. Non-optimized medications therapies which cost the US 275,000 lives and $528 billion annually.

Dramatic Growth - Arine is managing more than 18 million lives across prominent health plans after only 4 years in the market, and was ranked 236 on the 2024 Inc. 5000 list and was named the 5th fastest-growing company in the AI category.

The Role:

The Senior Data Analyst role will report to the Reporting and Analytics Manager and will work within the Product Insights team. This role will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of data-driven analytics for one or more of our product offerings. The Senior Data Analyst will conduct in-depth analyses of data, identify leading indicators, and provide meaningful interpretation of metrics and trends. The role will be a leading voice in our analytic workstreams, working cross-functionally with BI developers, engineers, customer success executives, and product.

What You'll Be Doing:


Lead and manage data analysis projects across cross-functional teams, ensuring timely delivery, accuracy, reliability and completeness
Drive meaningful interpretation of data findings, translating raw data into operational insights
Build comprehensive analytics frameworks to evaluate complex datasets and monitor key performance metrics
Identify and develop leading indicators to predict product performance and outcomes
Write efficient SQL queries and develop automated data pipelines to perform deep-dive analyses
Create and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards using data visualization tools to communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders
Develop subject-matter expertise in our product offerings and supporting operational and performance data
Collaborate with data science, customer success, and product teams to ensure that data analyses remain efficient and effective in supporting business objectives over time
Stay ahead of the latest trends and technologies in BI, data analytics, and data visualization to improve our BI capabilities continuously


Our Ideal Candidate Possesses:


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or related field
5-7 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related field
Demonstrated track record of leading complex analytical projects from conception to implementation
Expertise in extracting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights to inform business processes
Advanced SQL proficiency and practiced with data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or similar
Proven ability to act autonomously, take initiative and be innovative
Substantiated ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, prioritize multiple projects, and solve problems under tight deadlines and limited resources
Excellent written, interpersonal communication and presentation skills, including ability to present complex technical concepts in a clear, concise manner to audiences with varying levels of technical understanding
Experience with statistical analysis is a plus
Experience with healthcare is a plus


Remote Work Requirements:


An established private work area that ensures information privacy
A stable high-speed internet connection for remote work
This role is remote, but you will be required to come to on-site meetings multiple times per year. This may be in the interview process, onboarding, and team meetings


Perks:

Joining Arine offers you a dynamic role and the opportunity to contribute to the company's growth and shape its future. You'll have unparalleled learning and growth prospects, collaborating closely with experienced Clinicians, Engineers, Software Architects, and Digital Health Entrepreneurs.

The posted range represents the expected salary for this position and does not include any other potential components of the compensation package, benefits, and perks. Ultimately, the final pay decision will consider factors such as your experience, job level, location, and other relevant job-related criteria. The salary range for this position is: $145,000-$160,000/year.

Job Requirements:


Ability to pass a background check
Must live in and be eligible to work in the United States


Information Security Roles and Responsibilities:

All staff at Arine are expected to be part of its Information Security Management Program and undergo periodic training on Information Security Awareness and HIPAA guidelines. Each user is responsible to maintain a secure working environment and follow all policies and procedures. Upon hire, each person is assigned and must complete trainings before access is granted for their specific role within Arine.

Arine is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where all employees are treated with fairness and respect. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or any other legally protected status. Our hiring decisions and employment practices are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply and join us in our mission.

Check our website at https://www.arine.io. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing start-up revolutionizing the healthcare industry!

Job Offers: Arine uses the arine.io domain and email addresses for all official communications. If you received communication from any other domain, please consider it spam.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: We appreciate your interest in finding talent for Arine, but please be advised that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies. All resumes submitted to Arine without a prior written agreement in place will be considered property of Arine, and no fee will be paid in the event of a hire. Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Envoy builds workspace management technology that makes it simple to run secure, compliant, and connected workplaces across every location. Over 16,000 workplaces and properties around the world rely on Envoy to create great experiences for employees and visitors while meeting safety, security, and compliance needs at scale. From corporate headquarters and labs to manufacturing sites, Envoy powers the places where people work best together.

Learn more at envoy.com

About The Role

We are a data-driven organization that values analytical rigor, innovation, and collaborative impact. Our team maintains high standards across our modern data stack, engineering practices, and analytical frameworks while fostering a culture of continuous learning and diverse perspectives.

We're seeking an experienced data professional to accelerate our analytics capabilities and drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You'll collaborate with product, marketing, sales, and engineering teams to deliver actionable insights, build predictive models, and influence key business decisions through data storytelling and evidence-based recommendations.

Our data platform is built on a modern stack including AWS Redshift, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, dbt, and Airflow for orchestration. We leverage Looker and Databricks for analytics and exploration. We're actively exploring real-time analytics solutions, MLOps tooling like SageMaker, MLflow, and Feature Stores, as well as incorporating generative AI use cases using LangChain, LLM APIs, and vector databases.

This is an on-site position that requires 4 days a week (Monday-Thursday) in our San Francisco HQ.

You will

Strategic Analysis & Insights


Partner with cross-functional teams to design and execute high-impact analytics projects that drive product strategy and business growth
Develop sophisticated analyses using modern statistical methods, machine learning, and causal inference techniques
Conduct deep-dive investigations into user behavior, product performance, and market trends


Advanced Analytics & Modeling


Build and deploy predictive models, recommendation systems, and forecasting solutions
Design and implement robust A/B testing frameworks and analyze experimental results
Create automated reporting dashboards and real-time monitoring systems


Data Leadership & Strategy


Influence product roadmap and business strategy through compelling data narratives and executive presentations
Establish analytics best practices and data governance standards
Mentor junior analysts and contribute to team knowledge sharing


Innovation & Research


Explore emerging analytics techniques, including generative AI applications for data analysis
Evaluate and implement new tools and technologies to enhance analytical capabilities
Contribute to our data science research initiatives and thought leadership


You are

Technical Excellence


You have exceptionally high standards for data quality and analytical rigor, understanding that trust in data is fundamental to business impact
You're pragmatic about balancing perfection with delivery timelines, always striving for excellence while maintaining velocity
You think systematically about data architecture, measurement frameworks, and end-to-end analytical processes


Business Acumen


You're an owner who takes personal accountability for outcomes and proactively identifies opportunities for improvement
You thrive in fast-paced environments where your work directly impacts product decisions and business results
You have strong product intuition and can translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations


Growth Mindset


You're passionate about continuous learning, staying current with emerging tools, methodologies, and industry best practices
You're intellectually curious and eager to explore new analytical approaches and technologies
You value feedback and actively seek opportunities to improve your craft


Collaboration & Communication


You're emotionally intelligent and prioritize team success over individual recognition
You excel at explaining complex analytical concepts to diverse audiences, from engineers to executives
You're empathetic and supportive, particularly when mentoring junior team members


You have

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or related quantitative field
5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or related roles
Proven track record of influencing business strategy through data-driven insights


Technical Skills


Expert-level SQL proficiency with experience in modern data warehouses (Redshift,Postgres, Databricks)
Advanced Python skills with deep knowledge of data science libraries (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, matplotlib, seaborn)
Experience with modern analytics tools such as dbt, Looker, Tableau, or similar. Hands-on expertise with dbt for building modular, version-controlled, and testable data transformation pipelines.
Proficiency in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and experimental design
Working knowledge of version control (Git) and command-line tools


Analytical Expertise


Strong foundation in applied statistics, regression analysis, and machine learning
Experience with A/B testing, causal inference, and experimental design
Ability to create compelling data visualizations and interactive dashboards
Experience with time series analysis and forecasting techniques


Bonus points

Advanced Technical Skills


Experience with cloud platforms including AWS (preferred), GCP, and Azure, with a strong understanding of modern data infrastructure and services.
Knowledge of machine learning operations (MLOps) and model deployment
Familiarity with real-time analytics and streaming data processing


Business & Leadership


Track record of success in fast-paced startup or scale-up environments
Experience leading cross-functional analytics projects
Background in product analytics, growth metrics, or business intelligence
Experience with modern experimentation platforms and statistical methods


Emerging Technologies


Familiarity with generative AI tools and their applications in data analysis
Experience with automated reporting and self-service analytics platforms
Knowledge of data mesh architectures and modern data governance frameworks


You'll get


High degree of autonomy and trust in your analytical judgment
Direct impact on product strategy and business outcomes
Mentorship opportunities and career development support
Collaborative environment with talented, diverse team members
Opportunity to shape the future of workplace technology through data


If you have any questions related to compensation, please contact Recruiting after you apply.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge that you have fully read and understand the job requirements and received the Envoy Privacy Notice for applicants, which is linked here. Completing this application requires you to provide personal data, such as your name and contact information, which is mandatory for Envoy to process your application. Envoy is an EEO Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of any characteristic protected by local, state or federal law.

Compensation Range: $162.5K - $180K

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Analyst Contractor to support our Expense Manager with data-driven insights and reporting. This role will focus on analyzing financial and operational data, building reports, and supporting budgeting and forecasting efforts with a strong emphasis on data accuracy and visualization.


Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain monthly reporting packages using Excel and BI tools
Analyze expense data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for cost optimization
Support budget entry and updates across systems
Assist with 2026 forecasting by preparing historical data sets and scenario modeling
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data consistency and integrity

Tools & Systems

ERP: NetSuite (experience with other ERPs is welcome)
BI Tool: Tableau (used primarily on the revenue side; nice to have)
Other: SQL experience is a plus for data extraction and transformation





Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®

We’re looking for a Data Analyst Contractor to support our Expense Manager with data-driven insights and reporting. This role will focus on analyzing financial and operational data, building reports, and supporting budgeting and forecasting efforts with a strong emphasis on data accuracy and visualization.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain monthly reporting packages using Excel and BI tools
  • Analyze expense data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for cost optimization
  • Support budget entry and updates across systems
  • Assist with 2026 forecasting by preparing historical data sets and scenario modeling
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data consistency and integrity

Tools & Systems

  • ERP: NetSuite (experience with other ERPs is welcome)
  • BI Tool: Tableau (used primarily on the revenue side; nice to have)
  • Other: SQL experience is a plus for data extraction and transformation



Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®



Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.



Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, notifications of AI-matched jobs, and much more.



Robert Half will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit roberthalf.gobenefits.net for more information.



© 2025 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to Robert Half’s Terms of Use.

Title: Principal Insights Analyst, LMS Customer Insights
Description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

This position can be performed in New York City or San Francisco depending upon which location the applicant chosen for the role is currently residing.

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

At LinkedIn we believe that marketing is what accelerates business growth and that nearly all the levers of business growth are driven by marketing. Because of this, we are passionate about helping marketers unlock growth for their companies and seeing them thrive. We work with our customers to empower them to make more effective marketing and business decisions with insights leveraging one of the richest proprietary data sets in the world.   

Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in advancing our vision to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce by helping organizations thrive and grow through marketing excellence. LinkedIn Marketing Solutions (LMS) Customer Insights team is seeking a dynamic, visionary Principal Insights Analyst with a strong technical background and proven expertise in marketing analytics and measurement innovation to join our global team which is responsible for developing and scaling leading-edge marketing measurement and insights solutions to support our sales teams with deepening strategic relationships with our marketing customers and driving commercial outcomes powered by the experiences of LinkedIn’s 1B+ members spanning over 200 countries and territories.

Key responsibilities for this role include data solutions innovation aligned to new platform products, features and associated measurement and insights solutions using advanced analytics and technical partner solutions to deliver world-class marketing and business intelligence to unlock new paths for market differentiation and growth. Realizing the vision for this role will require developing and scaling complex customer insights and measurement solutions for enterprise customers, working in close collaboration with sales teams and cross-functional partners to enable LMS sales teams to better nurture and grow existing customers through insights and measurement innovation. The ideal candidate is highly customer-centric, consultative, and thrives in a collaborative environment with team members and cross-function partners in Marketing, Product, Data Science and Data Engineering.

Responsibilities: 

Solutions Innovation


Lead Customer Insights custom solutions delivery and innovation for large enterprise customers focusing on new data solutions design, development and implementation leveraging advanced analytics and data modeling techniques
Drive alignment, prioritization, risk assessments and issues mitigation across team deliverables to ensure delivery against SLAs, knowledge transfer and quality controls.
Advise senior Product and Engineering partners on prioritization of data table access, core tables development, bug fixes and technical enhancements, including development of on-demand scale solutions.



Team Leadership


Lead teams to consistently deliver high quality work with appropriate visibility and aligned to quality standards.
Design and implement new ways of working that increase Customer Insights impact on the business and accelerate time to value
Create a collaborative work environment by fostering knowledge sharing, constructive feedback, transparency, accountability and continuous learning
Coach and mentor team members, in best-practice of modern planning and execution -- modeling LinkedIn’s culture and values; serve as a role model for Customer Insights analysts while influencing stakeholders to think more strategically and creatively about data solutions to unlock customer growth.



Stakeholder Partnerships


Work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to lead in capturing complex business requirements, determining solution prioritization and evaluating customer needs and resourcing
Establish strong partnerships with Sales, Product, Product Marketing, Engineering and Data Science teams to advance the development and scaling of advertising insights and measurement solutions
Be a world-class collaborator who can build trust, influence and co-create effectively with a diverse group of partners across the global Customer Insights and broader LMS organizations.



Commercial Impact


Act as a trusted advisor to sales partners and customers, offering expertise on advanced measurement and insights capability areas -- including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development.
Ensure all measurement and insights innovations align with key commercial objectives, equipping sales teams with insights that support revenue expansion, relationship-building, and strategic advisory capabilities
Lead in the development of new and innovative Customer Insights scale assets (e.g., meta analyses) that demonstrate the value of new and existing platform features and ad formats, while expanding the business use cases for LinkedIn’s first-party data
Leverage marketing analytics and technical subject matter expertise to meaningfully influence and impact key business priorities and customer outcomes



Qualifications

Basic Qualifications 


10+ years of experience in digital media analytics, marketing analytics, performance marketing, media consulting or related industry
5+ years of technical data analytics project experience in customer-facing consultative roles
Experience in advanced SQL, python, data modelling, marketing analytics methodologies (e.g., including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development
Bachelors or above in a Marketing, data science, computer science, engineering, mathematics or other quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience



 Preferred Qualifications 


15+ years of experience in digital media analytics, marketing analytics, media consulting or related industry
7+ years of technical data analytics project management experience in customer-facing consultative roles
Strong analytical and adaptive problem-solving skills, with a focus on driving actionable insights from complex data sets
Strong commercial and customer success orientation, with proven track record developing insights and measurement solutions aligned to commercial outcomes
Experience with CRM platform technology and data structures, identity solutions data cleanroom technologies (e.g., Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp, Snowflake, InfoSum)
Expertise in advanced SQL, python, data modelling, marketing analytics methodologies (e.g., including MMM, MMT, incrementality (e.g., conversion lift testing) and advanced SQL query development
Experience with CRM, identity solutions data cleanroom technologies (e.g., Google Ads Data Hub, LiveRamp, Snowflake)
Experience with LLM and Gen-AI techniques
Excellent business judgment, strategic thinking and solutions orientation
Experience in B2B marketing analytics and marketing intelligence, or B2B consulting
Experience working directly with engineering and technical teams, as well as individual contributors
Excellent communication, presentation skills and experience presenting to executive stakeholders and influencing senior leadership
Experience working with offshore analyst teams



Suggested skills 


Digital Marketing
Performance Analytics
Data-driven Consulting
Project Management
Executive Stakeholder Management



LinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

The pay range for this role is $148,000 to $230,000. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location. This may be different in other locations due to differences in the cost of labor.

The total compensation package for this position may also include annual performance bonus, stock, benefits and/or other applicable incentive compensation plans. For more information, visit https://careers.linkedin.com/benefits.

Additional Information

Equal Opportunity Statement

We seek candidates with a wide range of perspectives and backgrounds and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. LinkedIn considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

LinkedIn is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. Our goal is to foster an inclusive and accessible workplace where everyone has the opportunity to be successful.

If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, apply for a position, or participate in the interview process, connect with us at accommodations@linkedin.com and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disability-related limitation.

Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process. Examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to:


Documents in alternate formats or read aloud to you
Having interviews in an accessible location
Being accompanied by a service dog
Having a sign language interpreter present for the interview



A request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days. However, non-disability related requests, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.

LinkedIn will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by LinkedIn, or (c) consistent with LinkedIn's legal duty to furnish information.

San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, LinkedIn will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pay Transparency Policy Statement

As a federal contractor, LinkedIn follows the Pay Transparency and non-discrimination provisions described at this link: https://lnkd.in/paytransparency.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates

Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

Title: Manufacturing Data Analyst
Description:
Zoox is seeking a systems-minded and execution-driven Data Analyst to partner with our Manufacturing, Logistics, Test, and Quality teams. This role is critical in helping teams make data-informed decisions by automating data extraction, integrating cross-platform insights, and developing scalable analytics infrastructure.

You will work across tools like Jira, SAP, 3DX, MES, and Ignition to transform fragmented data into unified, real-time dashboards and reporting solutions. Whether it’s visualizing inbound logistics delays, automating defect tracking, or building predictive metrics around first pass yield, you shall play a hands-on role in shaping how operational teams use data, helping them replace ad hoc processes with sustainable, structured data pipelines.

The ideal candidate will bring a strong blend of data analytics expertise, cross-system understanding, and operational awareness to help teams drive measurable improvements in cycle times, workflow efficiency, and overall transparency across manufacturing operations.

Responsibilities


Translate operational challenges and data pain points into structured analytics requirements by defining clear metrics and delivering actionable, data-driven insights to support decision-making.
Design and automate end-to-end data workflows—including extraction, transformation, storage, and visualization—across systems such as Jira, SAP, 3DX, MES, and Ignition.
Build and maintain scalable, user-friendly dashboards (e.g., Looker, Tableau) that monitor critical KPIs, including first pass yield, inbound cycle time, non-conformance rates, and equipment utilization.
Lead cross-functional analytics initiatives by scoping workstreams, aligning stakeholders, establishing realistic timelines, and driving projects to completion.
Improve data quality and reliability by leading data hygiene efforts and standardizing KPI definitions across teams to ensure consistent, trustworthy reporting.
Develop and maintain intermediate datasets, bridge fragmented data sources, and contribute to data model design to prepare the organization for scalable analytics and future AI/ML integration.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, or related discipline
5+ years of hands-on experience in operations analytics, business intelligence, or technical problem-solving within manufacturing, logistics, or service operations.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and emerging AI tools, with a strong ability to analyze and interpret complex datasets.
Demonstrated success in designing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.
Proven ability to work cross-functionally with operations and technical teams to frame problems, define metrics, and deliver actionable insights.
Strong communication and data storytelling skills, with the ability to present complex insights to non-technical stakeholders and drive alignment on decisions.


Bonus Qualifications


Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Data Science, or related discipline.
Experience with manufacturing execution systems (MES), logistics systems (SAP, EWM ), or engineering systems (3DX).
Working knowledge of lean manufacturing, test operations, logistics workflows, and key metrics like first-pass yield, PO cycle time, and NC tracking.
Proficiency in advanced analytics tools (Python, R) and experience driving KPI standardization or data quality initiatives across teams.
Familiarity with data modeling, dashboard governance, and preparing datasets for scalable analytics or future AI/ML integration.


$150,000 - $206,000 a year

Base Salary Range

There are three major components to compensation for this position: salary, Amazon Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), and Zoox Stock Appreciation Rights. A sign-on bonus may be offered as part of the compensation package. The listed range applies only to the base salary. Compensation will vary based on geographic location and level. Leveling, as well as positioning within a level, is determined by a range of factors, including, but not limited to, a candidate's relevant years of experience, domain knowledge, and interview performance. The salary range listed in this posting is representative of the range of levels Zoox is considering for this position.

Zoox also offers a comprehensive package of benefits, including paid time off (e.g. sick leave, vacation, bereavement), unpaid time off, Zoox Stock Appreciation Rights, Amazon RSUs, health insurance, long-term care insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance, and life insurance.

About Zoox

Zoox is developing the first ground-up, fully autonomous vehicle fleet and the supporting ecosystem required to bring this technology to market. Sitting at the intersection of robotics, machine learning, and design, Zoox aims to provide the next generation of mobility-as-a-service in urban environments. We’re looking for top talent that shares our passion and wants to be part of a fast-moving and highly execution-oriented team.

Follow us on LinkedIn

Accommodations

If you need an accommodation to participate in the application or interview process please reach out to accommodations@zoox.com or your assigned recruiter.

A Final Note

You do not need to match every listed expectation to apply for this position. Here at Zoox, we know that diverse perspectives foster the innovation we need to be successful, and we are committed to building a team that encompasses a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and skills.

Title: BI Reporting Analyst III - Remote
Description:
Responsibilities

A client with Kforce is seeking a BI Reporting Analyst III to join their team. This is a remote opportunity. This role will join the CoM DS team to support key metric and funnel definitions, improve performance and stability of data pipelines, and build stable reporting across CoM products. The BI Reporting Analyst will maintain and enhance foundational data pipelines that power self-service analytics, automate critical reporting workflows to significantly reduce manual efforts, and ensure pipelines are consistently refreshed with new or seasonal data. This role also involves collaborating with stakeholders to leverage standardized test reporting frameworks to make business decisions. In Season:


Maintenance of the Data Foundations layer needed to supercharge self-serving capabilities for "CoM Product reporting"
Automation of in-season KPI reporting and opportunity identification on CoM products to reduce the weekly lift


Out Of Season


Improve existing CoM reporting capabilities - We have existing pipelines and reporting dashboards for Fast Money products: RAD/ERAD, RT, XDE, and CKM that need to be shored up through defining key funnel metrics, identifying more stable backend metrics in place of front end clickstream, optimizing pipeline performance, and improving business facing reporting
Build and/or collaborate with other analytics enablements teams on New CoM reporting capabilities for short-term lending products (FNPL, RiL) with similar functions - define key metrics using backend source of truth where available, leverage best practices for data pipeline performance and quality, and business facing reporting
Develop self-serve capabilities for CoM testing to drive consistency with those used for relevant funnel / product scope areas (ie. FnF, Shopping)


Requirements


Strong SQL and data modeling skills
Experience building scalable data pipelines (expertise in BI tools)
Proven track record of working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making
To be considered for this position, candidates must have experience in a similar role, or they must possess significant knowledge, experience, and abilities to successfully perform the responsibilities listed
Relevant education and/or training will be considered a plus


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

HTML:
Responsibilities

A client with Kforce is seeking a BI Reporting Analyst III to join their team. This is a remote opportunity. This role will join the CoM DS team to support key metric and funnel definitions, improve performance and stability of data pipelines, and build stable reporting across CoM products. The BI Reporting Analyst will maintain and enhance foundational data pipelines that power self-service analytics, automate critical reporting workflows to significantly reduce manual efforts, and ensure pipelines are consistently refreshed with new or seasonal data. This role also involves collaborating with stakeholders to leverage standardized test reporting frameworks to make business decisions. In Season:

  • Maintenance of the Data Foundations layer needed to supercharge self-serving capabilities for "CoM Product reporting"
  • Automation of in-season KPI reporting and opportunity identification on CoM products to reduce the weekly lift

Out Of Season

  • Improve existing CoM reporting capabilities - We have existing pipelines and reporting dashboards for Fast Money products: RAD/ERAD, RT, XDE, and CKM that need to be shored up through defining key funnel metrics, identifying more stable backend metrics in place of front end clickstream, optimizing pipeline performance, and improving business facing reporting
  • Build and/or collaborate with other analytics enablements teams on New CoM reporting capabilities for short-term lending products (FNPL, RiL) with similar functions - define key metrics using backend source of truth where available, leverage best practices for data pipeline performance and quality, and business facing reporting
  • Develop self-serve capabilities for CoM testing to drive consistency with those used for relevant funnel / product scope areas (ie. FnF, Shopping)

Requirements

  • Strong SQL and data modeling skills
  • Experience building scalable data pipelines (expertise in BI tools)
  • Proven track record of working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making
  • To be considered for this position, candidates must have experience in a similar role, or they must possess significant knowledge, experience, and abilities to successfully perform the responsibilities listed
  • Relevant education and/or training will be considered a plus

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Consultant

Job Location: Reston, VA 20170

Onsite Requirements:

Business Intelligence
Build and manage automated data pipelines to collect, process, and store data from various sources (e.g., monitoring metrics, KPI dashboards, operational systems).
Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Grafana) and SQL. Experience with data pipeline development and ETL processes.

Job Description:

As a member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team, you will be responsible for developing dashboards, tools, and data solutions that track and analyze organizational performance, trends, and patterns.
You will work closely with stakeholders to understand analytical requirements, design business solutions, and deliver actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, implement, and maintain interactive dashboards and reporting tools.
Write, test, and debug code to support new data solutions and BI capabilities.
Enhance and maintain existing BI solutions based on clear business requirements.
Build and manage automated data pipelines to collect, process, and store data from various sources (e.g., monitoring metrics, KPI dashboards, operational systems).
Develop a unified reporting framework to streamline access to key data across stakeholders.
Perform data analysis using techniques ranging from basic aggregation to advanced statistical methods and data mining.
Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to best practices and coding standards.
Collaborate with business leaders and project stakeholders to identify and refine analytical requirements.
Continuously develop expertise in assigned solutions, technologies, development processes, and the broader BI ecosystem.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field.
3-6 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a related area.
Proficiency with BI tools (e.g., Grafana) and SQL.
Experience with data pipeline development and ETL processes.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and data mining techniques.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail and data quality.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.

**3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.
This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future.
This client is a US Federal Government contractor and is legally required to hire US Citizens. US Citizens will only be considered for this role**

Title: Associate, eDiscovery
Description:
Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth.

Practice Overview

Bright Labs, proudly a part of Ankura, is at the forefront of the eDiscovery industry, having contributed to some of the most significant and globally recognized eDiscovery investigations and litigations. Our eDiscovery team is renowned for its deep expertise and innovative approach, leveraging data, technology, and analytical thought to address complex client issues. We pride ourselves on a unique combination of technical skills, subject-matter expertise, and litigation technology experience, enabling us to deliver comprehensive, creative, and insightful solutions that guide our clients through the intricacies of eDiscovery challenges.

The role is located in Chicago, New York, San Francisco, or Washington D.C.. There will be hybrid opportunity within these four locations.

Role Overview

We are seeking an eDiscovery Associate to join our dynamic team. This role involves applying expertise in forensics, processing, production of Electronically Stored Information (ESI), predictive analytics, machine learning, eDiscovery project management, and technology consulting. Our goal is to enhance case strategies, reduce discovery costs, and optimize litigation profiles by effectively collecting, managing, and analyzing vast amounts of structured and unstructured data.

What We Offer


The opportunity to work on some of the largest and most recognized global eDiscovery cases.
A collaborative environment where creativity and insight are valued.
Exposure to cutting-edge technology and methodologies in the field of digital forensics and eDiscovery.
A supportive team that fosters professional growth and development.


Responsibilities


Collaborate with clients to design efficient eDiscovery workflows.
Proactively identify and mitigate risks, ensuring quality control throughout the eDiscovery lifecycle.
Solve technological challenges and provide cost-effective solutions.
Utilize the latest advances in data science, predictive analytics, and machine learning to transform large datasets into actionable intelligence.
Work with a wide range of industry-standard technologies and procedures.


Requirements


BA/BS in MIS, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Law, Engineering, Finance, Accounting, Economics, Information Technology, or similar degree.
Experience with digital forensics, eDiscovery, processing, and production of ESI a plus.
Interest in applying detail-oriented project management skills and cutting edge solutions involving analytics and machine learning to novel data.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to challenges.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with clients and team members.


For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in California, Colorado, or New York, Ankura is required to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the said markets and considers a broad range of factors including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. The range does not include additional benefits outside of salary. At Ankura, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each role. A reasonable estimate of the current base pay range is between $50,000 to $120,000; this range is not a promise of a particular wage.

Ankura is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against based on disability. Equal Employment Opportunity Posters, if you have a disability and believe you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, submit an online application, or participate in an interview/assessment, please email accommodations@ankura.com or call toll-free +1.312-583-2122. This email and phone number are created exclusively to assist disabled job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned. Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or technical issues unrelated to a disability, will not receive a response.
