Title: Data Analyst Junior
Description:
VINCLE, consultora tecnológica en expansión, busca incorporar para un importante proyecto con gran multinacional de gran consumo, un Data Analyst Junior.




Te incorporarás a uno de los proyectos más pioneros del mercado, basado en la automatización de la demanda y de los suministros. Centrado en elaborar la previsión de la demanda y asegurar que el nivel de stock es el que se establece desde la dirección del departamento. Todo centralizado en departamentos de Supply y Demand.




🚀 FUNCIONES PRINCIPALES:

- Responsable del seguimiento y análisis de los KPI's clave del proyecto: Forecast Accuracy, Cambios, OSA, Freshness, Ventas.

- Interlocución con los departamentos de sistemas y gestión de incidencias relacionadas con el Forecast como principal input de la generación de los pedidos.

- Mantenimiento de los parámetros necesarios para el correcto dimensionamiento de los pedidos.

- Animación y seguimiento del forecast así como tareas que garantizan el nivel de servicio.




🔎 ¿Qué buscamos?:

Formación Superior en ADE, Ingenieria Industrial, Ingenieria Quimica, Grado en Matemáticas o similar.
Deseable haber realizado Erasmus o estancias en el extranjero por estudios o trabajo.
Experiencia de 1 año en puesto similar sobre todo en empresa de gran consumo y en análisis de datos.
Se valorará experiencia previa en departamentos de logística, demand.
Dominio avanzado de excel (tablas dinámicas, macros, formulación, ...)
Muy valorable conocimientos de herramientas de análisis estadístico: Matlab, SAS, Revolution Analytics, BI, ...
Capacidad de análisis, gestión y resolución.
Actitud positiva ante situaciones complejas.
Alto nivel de aprendizaje y compromiso con el trabajo.
Persona con entusiasmo, ganas de trabajar y actitud positiva.




✨ ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Horario: 40 horas semanale de Lunes a Viernes: L – J 9:00h a 18:30h y V 8:30h a 15:00h
Contrato Indefinido.
Ubicación del puesto: centro Barcelona.
Incorporación inmediata.
Show more
HTML:
VINCLE, consultora tecnológica en expansión, busca incorporar para un importante proyecto con gran multinacional de gran consumo, un Data Analyst Junior.


Te incorporarás a uno de los proyectos más pioneros del mercado, basado en la automatización de la demanda y de los suministros. Centrado en elaborar la previsión de la demanda y asegurar que el nivel de stock es el que se establece desde la dirección del departamento. Todo centralizado en departamentos de Supply y Demand.


🚀 FUNCIONES PRINCIPALES:

- Responsable del seguimiento y análisis de los KPI's clave del proyecto: Forecast Accuracy, Cambios, OSA, Freshness, Ventas.

- Interlocución con los departamentos de sistemas y gestión de incidencias relacionadas con el Forecast como principal input de la generación de los pedidos.

- Mantenimiento de los parámetros necesarios para el correcto dimensionamiento de los pedidos.

- Animación y seguimiento del forecast así como tareas que garantizan el nivel de servicio.


🔎 ¿Qué buscamos?:

  • Formación Superior en ADE, Ingenieria Industrial, Ingenieria Quimica, Grado en Matemáticas o similar.
  • Deseable haber realizado Erasmus o estancias en el extranjero por estudios o trabajo.
  • Experiencia de 1 año en puesto similar sobre todo en empresa de gran consumo y en análisis de datos.
  • Se valorará experiencia previa en departamentos de logística, demand.
  • Dominio avanzado de excel (tablas dinámicas, macros, formulación, ...)
  • Muy valorable conocimientos de herramientas de análisis estadístico: Matlab, SAS, Revolution Analytics, BI, ...
  • Capacidad de análisis, gestión y resolución.
  • Actitud positiva ante situaciones complejas.
  • Alto nivel de aprendizaje y compromiso con el trabajo.
  • Persona con entusiasmo, ganas de trabajar y actitud positiva.


✨ ¿Qué ofrecemos?

  • Horario: 40 horas semanale de Lunes a Viernes: L – J 9:00h a 18:30h y V 8:30h a 15:00h
  • Contrato Indefinido.
  • Ubicación del puesto: centro Barcelona.
  • Incorporación inmediata.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

We want to do different with the essential’s things.

We are committed to a sustainable corporatism strategy. We believe that success is based on building a team focused on collective well-being, personal and professional development, and based on a work philosophy that enhances the healthy management of our lives. Work-life balance, beginner’s mind and community involvement are our identity, our foundations, and our culture.




What you need to join us:




Higher education degree in Computer Engineering or a similar field;
3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Strong skills in SQL and data modeling.
Solid hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric
Ability to design insightful and user-friendly dashboards and reports (Power BI or similar).




-> Important notes:

Remote project in Portugal;

English fluency is a plus.




What do we have to offer you:




- Personalized Talent Management. We value and privilege a close and regular follow-up; we are a team from day one.

- Broad and flexible benefits package. Health insurance, life and personal accident insurance, discounts and benefits, telecommunications plan and much more.

- We invest in training and in your career. Certified training, online training platforms, Pearson VUE exam center... We bet on you!

- Sustainability and community involvement. We want to give meaning to our work and invest in an inclusive consulting project. For that, we need your help.




team.it, back to basics!

Will you join us?

Title: Data Analyst with Power BI
Description:
Offer description

The consultant should be ready to work hybrid twice a week from the office in Wrocław. The team is a mature and deals with both solution maintenance and migration to PBI from historical tools. The team cares about good communication and knowledge of end-to-end solutions in Power BI.




Business Analysis Expertise: The ideal candidate should have a strong grasp of business operations, encompassing strategic planning, process improvement, and data-driven decision-making. They must be able to translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that accelerate organizational growth. We are looking for at least 4 years of experience in the data area.




Advanced Power BI Proficiency: Mastery of Power BI is a core requirement. The consultant should demonstrate expertise in leveraging Power BI’s capabilities to design dynamic reports, interactive dashboards, and advanced data visualizations. Their skills should include data modeling, query optimization, and the seamless integration of diverse data sources.




Machine Learning Knowledge: Understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical application is highly desirable.




Strong SQL Knowledge: The candidate should possess advanced SQL expertise and proven track of record working with corporate solutions, with the ability to write efficient queries and manage complex data transformations across large datasets.




Basic Knowledge of Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks is desirable, including a foundational understanding of its collaborative environment for data engineering, machine learning, and analytics.




20 000 – 22 000 PLN + VAT (B2B) per month

Title: Data Analyst - Fintech
Description:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies


Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)


YOUR TEAM:


We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus


Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options—no blackout days!


Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Description

Tango is a successful, market leader, a live-streaming Platform with 450+ Million registered users, in an industry projected to reach $240 BILLION in the next couple of years.

The B2C platform, based on the best-quality global video technology, allows millions of talented people around the world to create their own live content, engage with their fans, and monetize their talents.

Tango live stream was founded in 2018 and is powered by 450+ global employees operating in a culture of growth, learning, and success!

The Tango team is a vigorous cocktail of hard workers, creative brains, energizers, geeks, overachievers, athletes, and more. We push the limits to bring our app from “one of the top” to “the leader”.

The best way to describe Tango's work style is not to use the word “impossible”. We believe that success is a thorny path that runs on sleepless nights, corporate parties, tough releases, and of course our users' smiles (and as we are a LIVE app, we truly get to see our users all around the world smiling right in front of us in real-time!).

Do you want to join the party?


Responsibilities:


  • Work collaboratively with business owners and engineers to ensure that any product/business decisions are being made informed by data;
  • Build, maintain and update the company's dashboards and their underlying data sets related to your domain;
  • Monitor key metrics, identify business trends;
  • Present data-driven insights to business owners and executives;
  • Influence change with the outcome of your analysis and make recommendations to improve quality of user experience for more than 450+ Million registered users all over the globe;
  • Design, launch and analyze A/B tests;
  • Lead deep-dive analysis that will frame business strategy and roadmap decisions.


Requirements:


  • 2+ years of experience in a data or product analytics;
  • Advanced SQL skills, ability to perform complex queries including multiple JOINs, CTEs, window functions, query optimization etc;
  • Practical experience with BI visualization tools (Looker/Tableau/etc);
  • Good knowledge of statistics: confidence intervals, hypothesis checking etc;
  • Practical experience of production A/B testing;
  • Ability to perform extensive research providing business understandable insights;
  • Self-motivation, proactively going beyond the call of duty;
  • The ability to work comfortably in a constantly evolving environment;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • English language proficiency - B2 is the minimum.


What we offer:


  • Stock options grant (we’re a Silicon Valley Company)
  • Competitive salary
  • Medical insurance for you and 75% off for your relatives
  • Free lunches
  • Parking
  • Multisport card
  • Cheerful team spirit and fun office atmosphere

Title: Data Analyst (M/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

Committed, always willing to help your team

Team player: able to work in a multicultural environment

Proactive: you enjoy projects that move fast and run smoothly

Organized

Ensuite quoi

Main Responsibilities in the Role

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and deliver reports

Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and quality

Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to identify and correct coding issues

Identify and define new opportunities for process improvement

Education and Experience:

Studies in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering

Minimum 1 to 2 years of experience in a similar role

Knowledge of PHP and/or Python programming languages

Experience with Tableau or Power BI

Knowledge of SQL

What We Offer at Extia

Personalized career plan

Meal vouchers

Private health insurance

Public transport reimbursement

International and young work environment

Office just a few meters from the beach

Free drinks (beer, coffee, water, tea, milk)

Hybrid work mode (3 days remote, 2 days in office)

Events (training sessions, meetups, after-work socials, parties)

Anything you can think of will be welcome!

Title: Técnico de Análise de Dados e Projetos
HTML:
Country: Portugal

Estamos a recrutar um Técnico de Análise de Dados e Projetos, para a nossa Direção de Tecnologia & Operações.

Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Participar ativamente em projetos de desenvolvimento na área de operações, com o contributo analítico e funcional;
  • Desenvolver soluções fora do âmbito de IT. Exº: power automate, power BI;
  • Controlar e monitorizar de SLA's;
  • Comunicar e acompanhar os casos de quebra dos SLA's para garantir a sua resolução e/ou identificação da causa raiz;
  • Efetuar a análise processos críticos de Risco Operacional (RO) através do levantamento do processo junto das áreas e identificação de controlos mitigadores de RO;
  • Garantir junto das áreas a implementação dos controlos de mitigação identificados, assegurando a sua implementação e consequente seguimento;
  • Participar em projetos de desenvolvimento na área, com o contributo analítico e funcional;
  • Definir e produzir reportes;
  • Aplicar e controlar processos de melhoria contínua, assim como assegurar e controlar os planos de ação.

Perfil:

  • Conhecimento das ferramentas Power BI e Power Automate;
  • Experiência com Jira;
  • Bons conhecimentos de MS Excel;
  • Experiência em metodologia Agile;
  • Valoriza-se experiência no setor automóvel;
  • Conhecimentos de Inglês e Espanhol (preferencial);
  • Boa capacidade analítica, de planeamento e de gestão de prioridades;
  • Bom relacionamento interpessoal e gosto pelo trabalho em equipa;
  • Capacidade conceptual e analítica;
  • Atitude proativa na gestão dos riscos inerentes às atividades no seu dia-a-dia.

Title: Analista de datos BI
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
¡Dale un aire nuevo a tu vida y sigue creciendo en tu carrera dentro de SECURITAS DIRECT!

¿Quiénes somos?
Somos líderes en el mercado europeo de la protección y seguridad de personas para hogares y pequeños negocios, aportando un servicio excepcional a más de 3 millones de clientes/as con un equipo de más de 25.000 empleados, presentes en 17 países de Europa y América Latina. En Securitas Direct hemos creado las innovaciones más disruptivas del mercado, las cuales se han convertido en estándar para la industria y el sector. Combinamos la pasión, el compromiso, el compañerismo y la responsabilidad en nuestro día a día teniendo como foco principal el cuidado de nuestros clientes.

El departamento de Subdirección general de captación

Desde la subdirección general de captación, estamos buscando al mejor talento para incorporarse en nuestros equipos de negocio. En esta departamento trabajan 3 equipos con más de 20 profesionales liderando proyectos que impulsen la estrategia comercial de la empresa y la toma de decisiones a través del análisis de datos.

¿Quieres ser parte de nuestro crecimiento?

Reportando directamente al Head of del área de Business Intelligence dentro tu misión como Analista de Datos BI será el ayudar al cliente interno a la mejora de toma de decisiones  ayudando a identificar el problema de negocio y desarrollando la solución más adecuada, a través de la analitica del dato.

Responsabilidades en tu día a día

Automatización de Informes mediante la creación de Dashboards.

Estudios ad-hoc sobre el DWH Coorporativo para la ayuda de seguimientos de proyectos:

Análisis & Creación de KPIs de Negocio.

Prospección y análisis de nuevas variables.

Creación de Dashboards de seguimiento.

Entendimiento de procesos de Negocio, para una posterior creación de la lógica mediante procedimientos en SQL y así la obtención de los KPis de seguimiento.

Automatismos de Procesos de BI vía procesos en Python.

Requisitos de la posición

Titulación universitaria superior: Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar. 

Experiencia mínima de 3 años como consultor en proyectos de BI y Reporting, o en funciones similares que capaciten al candidato/a en el desarrollo de las funciones indicadas.

Dominio leguaje SQL y experiencia con BBDD (Snowflake, Sybase, SQL Server,…).

Experiencia con herramientas de Reporting sobre todo Power BI. Valorable Business Objects.

Conocimientos de herramientas Open Source (Python, R,…) .

Valorable Conocimientos de Hyperion.

Clara Orientación al Cliente.

Persona proactiva, analítica y con buena capacidad de comunicación.

Requisitos valorables:

Creación de Modelos Estadisticos de Optimización o de Segmentación.

Conocimiento en otras herramientas de reporting similares (Microstrategy, Qlik, Tableau,... ).

Conocimientos en herramientas de ETL.

Conocimientos de Gestión de Proyectos con IT.

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Modelo híbrido de teletrabajo (16 días de teletrabajo al trimestre) para que los adaptes a tus necesidades.

Horario flexible de entrada/salida y jornada intensiva los viernes.

22 días de vacaciones al año + 1 día de asuntos propios + bolsa de horas de exceso.

La tarde de tu cumpleaños ¡Libre!

Plan de carrera personalizado anual.

Comedor subvencionado, contamos con 3 restaurantes dentro de nuestra oficina por lo que ¡Olvídate de Tuppers!

Descuentos en productos propios.

Retribución flexible.

Apoyo a la maternidad, paternidad, políticas de igualdad y diversidad.

¿Y que hay acerca de la formación?
Serás el/la protagonista de tu ruta de aprendizaje, por lo que contarás con miles de recursos para seguir impulsando tu conocimiento técnico.

Más de 100h en formación en idiomas.

¡Tú eres protagonista de tu desarrollo! Tendrás la oportunidad de desarrollar un catálogo formativo adhoc adaptado a tu perfil profesional.

¿Y ahora qué?
Si has llegado hasta aquí es porque realmente te hemos parecido interesantes. Cómo próximos pasos, apúntate en nuestra oferta y el equipo de gestión de personas revisará tu perfil. Si encajas con la necesidad, te llamaremos para poder conocerte y darte más información acerca de la posición y de nosotros.

Como último consejo: ¡Se tú mismo/a!

¡Estamos deseando conocerte!

¿Quiénes somos?
Somos líderes en el mercado europeo de la protección y seguridad de personas para hogares y pequeños negocios, aportando un servicio excepcional a más de 3 millones de clientes/as con un equipo de más de 25.000 empleados, presentes en 17 países de Europa y América Latina. En Securitas Direct hemos creado las innovaciones más disruptivas del mercado, las cuales se han convertido en estándar para la industria y el sector. Combinamos la pasión, el compromiso, el compañerismo y la responsabilidad en nuestro día a día teniendo como foco principal el cuidado de nuestros clientes.

Title: Junior Data Analyst - Planning and Control
Description:
🚀 Ruolo: Junior Data Analyst - Planning and Control




📍 Località: Roma




🕒 Tipo di Contratto: Tempo Indeterminato




✨ Su di noi: Benvenuto/a in SIAE, la Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d’autore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi è una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.




🎯 La tua sfida: sei curioso/a di partecipare con noi e contribuire al cambiamento digitale di SIAE? Hai la passione per i progetti tecnologici e per la semplificazione dei processi?

Il candidato che stiamo cercando ha maturato almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Data Analyst in organizzazioni strutturate; avrà una solida mentalità analitica, una profonda comprensione dei dati e la capacità di tradurre informazioni complesse e dati grezzi in insights utili per guidare le decisioni strategiche dell’azienda.

La risorsa verrà inserita nell’U.O. Management Accounting & Segment Reporting, all’interno della Direzione Planning and Control e sarà chiamato a supportare il raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali attraverso lo svolgimento delle seguenti attività:




💼 Le Tue Responsabilità:

Analisi dati: raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati aziendali e da fonti esterne, sviluppare e implementare database per consentire l’analisi delle performance aziendali e la definizione di obiettivi.
Pianificazione: collaborare con il team per sviluppare piani strategici e operativi basati sull'analisi dei dati, supportando le attività di budgeting, forecasting e simulazioni.
Controllo di gestione: supportare il monitoraggio e la valutazione delle performance aziendali rispetto ai budget e ai forecast e la conseguente analisi degli scostamenti rispetto ai risultati attesi. Supportare il team nello sviluppo di query e nella definizione di procedure operative, nonché nella gestione e ottimizzazione della procedura di cost allocation.
Reportistica: supportare lo sviluppo e l’implementazione di report e dashboard per comunicare i risultati delle analisi e facilitare la presa di decisioni da parte dei responsabili.
Data Modeling: creare modelli e strumenti di analisi predittiva per supportare la previsione delle tendenze e la valutazione degli impatti delle decisioni aziendali.
Collaborazione interfunzionale: essere in grado di interfacciarsi con le diverse strutture aziendali per comprenderne di supporto analitico e le esigenze informative del management.
Ottimizzazione dei processi: identificare opportunità per ottimizzare i processi aziendali attraverso l'analisi dei dati e la proposta di soluzioni migliorative.




🎓 Requisiti:

Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Data Science, Economia/Finanza o campo correlato
Esperienza nell’analisi ed interpretazione dei dati
Interesse e predisposizione all’approfondimento di tematiche contabili e finanziarie
Buona conoscenza di Excel
Conoscenza avanzata di SQL. Nice to have conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione (e.g. Python)
Esperienza nell'utilizzo di software di business intelligence e data analytics (Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau)
Capacità di comunicare in modo efficace e presentare i risultati in modo chiaro
Passione per l’analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati. Attenzione al dettaglio e capacità di problem-solving
Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell’apprendimento continuo e dell’innovazione




🌈 Nice to have:

Forte engagement con il Purpose SIAE “dalla parte di chi crea”




💰 Cosa Offriamo:

Contributo Welfare Aziendale
Buoni Pasto da €6,5 al giorno
Smart Working per 10 giorni al mese
Premio di Risultato
Assistenza Sanitaria UniSalute
Contributo Previdenza Complementare
Borse di Studio per i figli
Convenzioni aziendali (Corporate benefits; Vickey)
Piattaforma di e-learning Edflex
Piattaforma Bonoos per agevolazioni, sconti e altre forme di sostegno ai cittadini




🌟 I nostri valori

Trust: conquistiamo la fiducia con sincerità e rispetto
Innovation: guardiamo al futuro proteggendo la nostra identità
Execution: crediamo in ciò che facciamo con responsabilità e passione




🚀 Unisciti a Noi: valutiamo tutte le candidature ricevute coerentemente con la cultura inclusiva e i valori che ci contraddistinguono ogni giorno, volti a valorizzare la diversità nelle sue molteplici forme come fondamentale contributo per la crescita aziendale e collettiva.




“Per informazioni sul trattamento dei dati personali, ti invitiamo a consultare la nostra Informativa sulla Privacy.”

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Summary

Location: Barcelona (Hybrid) or Prague (Hybrid)

Day Rate: Negotiable

Duration: 6 Months

Availability: ASAP




About the Client

My client is the air transport industry's IT provider, delivering solutions for airlines, airports, aircraft, and governments. Their technology powers more seamless, safe, and sustainable air travel. They are looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst to join on a contract basis for a 4 month contract.




About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and technically proficient Data Analyst to support the delivery and management of a centralized data archival system for financial and ERP platforms.

This is a techno-functional role that requires both hands-on technical skills and the ability to coordinate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure successful implementation and ongoing management of the archival solution.

The successful candidate will play a key role in ensuring that legacy and historical financial data is securely archived, easily accessible when required, and fully compliant with data privacy standards and regulatory obligations.

Working closely with an external vendor, internal IT, and the Finance department, the candidate will help design, test, and optimize archival processes to ensure alignment with business needs.




Key Duties:

• Lead and manage the testing, validation, and implementation of a centralized data archival system for finance and ERP data.

• Collaborate with external vendors and internal stakeholders (Finance, IT, Compliance) to ensure accurate delivery and integration of the archival solution.

• Ensure all archived data meets internal compliance standards and external regulatory requirements for retention, security, and access.

• Oversee and validate data mapping, extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) activities related to financial data archiving.

• Develop and maintain documentation for archival processes, testing scripts, and compliance checks.

• Monitor vendor performance and ensure deliverables are met according to project timelines and SLAs.

• Identify and troubleshoot issues in data archival processes and recommend improvements where applicable.

• Support audit and compliance reporting by providing timely access to archived data.




What we are looking for Knowledge & Skills:

• Proven experience in data management, financial systems, or ERP platforms (such as SAP, Oracle, or Workday).

• Strong SQL skills for querying, validating, and managing data sets.

• Deep understanding of ERP data structures, particularly those related to finance and accounting modules.

• Advanced Excel capabilities for data analysis, reconciliation, and reporting.

• Experience with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and financial data retention policies.

• Demonstrated experience working with third-party vendors and cross-functional project teams.

• Excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.

• Strong attention to detail with a methodical and organized approach to data.

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Au sein de l’équipe Products Systems Engineering, rattaché à l’agence de Toulouse vous occuperez le rôle Data Analyst H/F.

Dans le cadre de l'analyse des données, vous êtes en charge de l'automatisation des processus pour fournir des solutions efficaces et des visualisations claires.

Missions


Identifier les données pertinentes, définir le problème avec les instruments métiers, et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Implémenter des scripts pour extraire, transformer, charger (ETL), et fusionner des données complexes.
Structurer le code, créer des bases de données et schémas (ex. diagrammes UML), et garantir une solution durable.
Réaliser des analyses quantitatives et qualitatives, proposer des dashboards interactifs, et synthétiser les résultats.
Identifier des pistes d’amélioration, formuler des propositions, et travailler sur le développement d’outils avec les équipes informatiques.


Profil


De formation BAC+5 en data science, mathématique.
Vous avez une expérience significative de 5 années dans un poste similaire.
Vous disposez d’un niveau opérationnel en anglais.
Vous faites preuves d’un esprit d’analyse, de rigueur et d’une aisance relationnelle.
La maitrise des bases de données SQL et NoSQL / des langages : Data Science : Python, R, SQL, etc
La maitrise des outils de BI : Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, etc / des environnements cloud GCP, Azure ou Aws


Rémunération Et Avantages


Politique interne sur le télétravail
CSE (chèque vacances, culture, subvention pratique sportive, etc).
13 RTT + un compte épargne temps
Carte de tickets restaurant
Prévoyance Santé
Prime de vacances
Prime de cooptation
Contribution au remboursement de vos titres de transport en commun ou forfait à la mobilité durable
Salaire à partir de 40 000€ brut annuel suivant votre expertise


Notre Process De Recrutement


Vous candidatez,
Premier échange téléphonique avec notre équipe recrutement,
Un entretien avec votre futur manager et votre chargé de recrutement en agence ou en visio
Si validation, envoi de la proposition de collaboration
Début de votre parcours d’intégration chez Expleo !


A bientôt dans nos équipes !

La localisation des postes n’est qu’indicative, une mobilité géographique sur le territoire national peut être requise.

A compétences égales, une attention particulière sera accordée aux candidatures des travailleurs handicapés et autres bénéficiaires de l'obligation d'emploi de l'article L. 5212-2 du code du travail. »

  • Un entretien avec votre futur manager et votre chargé de recrutement en agence ou en visio
  • Si validation, envoi de la proposition de collaboration
  • Début de votre parcours d’intégration chez Expleo !

A bientôt dans nos équipes !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Excited to grow your career?

Citi is a world-leading global bank. We have approximately 200 million customer accounts and a presence in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions worldwide. We provide consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. We enable clients to achieve their strategic financial objectives by providing them with cutting-edge ideas, best-in-class products and solutions, and unparalleled access to capital and liquidity.

What do we do?

SMBF Production Management:

The SMBF Production Management organization provides business critical application management and support to our SMBF(Services, Markets, Banking and Functions) clients through our global and diverse team of over 5000 people positioned across 66 cities in 37 countries supporting ~3000 applications.

The Production Management organization is embarking on a multiyear evolution which will change how it delivers its services. This large-scale change programme has many different streams of work of which one is Optimization and Enablement. Optimization and Enablement will redefine not just what but how work is performed and drive a sustainable model for increased effectiveness and maturity across these services. At the heart of this transformation is data. This role will report into the Service Maturity Data and Analytics Lead and will be responsible for driving measurable change across this domain. The role will be “hands on” and the successful candidate will be very technically astute across a broad set of Technologies.

Who will be a great fit here?


Passionate Data & Analytics Advocate: You possess a very good understanding of data and analytics and are excited about leveraging its power to drive organizational change.
Develop and Visualize Insights: You have multiyear experience in creating compelling data visualizations and reports using tools like Tableau to communicate complex information clearly and effectively.
Strategic Thinker & Problem Solver: You are able to analyze complex situations, identify opportunities, and develop innovative solutions.
Technical Acumen: You have a strong command of data analysis tools and techniques, including experience with:
Data visualization tools
Programming languages
Data analysis and statistical methodologies
Effective Communicator: You can clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. You are adept at building relationships and fostering collaboration.
Results-Oriented: You are driven to deliver impactful results and have a proven track record of success in data and analytics initiatives.


Your role in our team would encompass the following and more:


Delivery of Enhanced Data & Analytics Maturity: Lead the charge in evolving our data and analytics capabilities within Production Management. You will champion the delivery and adoption of next-generation analytics, moving beyond descriptive and diagnostic analysis towards predictive and prescriptive insights.
Enable Data-Driven Decision Making: Collaborate across teams to define, measure, and communicate the impact of data and analytics initiatives. Your work will empower data-driven decision making and drive tangible and measurable improvements.
Deliver Innovation: Embrace a culture of innovation and continuous improvement. Explore and implement cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to enhance our data and analytics processes yielding measurable ROI


Qualifications:


Minimum 3 years of relevant experience
Project management experience and production support experience. Excellent communication and organization skills
Strong practical data analysis and visualization skills using tools such as Tableau
Advanced proficiency in MS Office suite. Practical experience using AI/Emerging Technologies
Strong Proficiency in Python, APIs, and DB connectivity (SQL), ETL. Familiarity with GitHub
Proven experience using JIRA / AGILE / SCRUM to deliver solutions. Data flame/Snowflake expertise
Proven IT Service Management (ITSM) knowledge and experience. Statistical/Business analysis experience
Proven ability handling and manipulating very large datasets


By joining Citi Solutions Center Poland, you will not only be part of a business casual workplace with a hybrid working model (up to 2 days working at home per week), but also receive a competitive base salary (which is annually reviewed) and enjoy a whole host of additional benefits such as:


Private Medical Care Program
Life Insurance Program
Pension Plan contribution (PPE Program)
Employee Assistance Program
Paid Parental Leave Program (maternity and paternity leave)
Sport Card
Holidays Allowance
Sport and team recreation activities
Special offers and discounts for employees
Access to an array of learning and development resources
A discretional annual performance related bonus
A chance to make a difference with various affinity networks and charity initiatives


Alongside these benefits Citi is committed to ensuring our workplace is where everyone feels comfortable coming to work as their whole self every day. We want the best talent around the world to be energized to join us, motivated to stay, and empowered to thrive.

Sounds like Citi has everything you need? Then apply to discover the true extent of your capabilities.

This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for data and analytics and are eager to make a significant impact in a global organization, we encourage you to apply!

Technology

Full time

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
En BCNC Group, para nuestro cliente Vueling, estamos buscando un/a Data Analyst con mentalidad crítica y perfil proactivo. Tu misión va más allá de la técnica: serás un pilar clave para transformar datos en decisiones.




En este rol, te encargarás de:

Storytelling con Datos: Generar visualizaciones e interpretaciones efectivas (tableros, gráficos, mapeos) con Tableau o Power BI, dando sentido al análisis y contando una historia clara a las áreas de negocio.
Puente con el Negocio: Liderar, junto al Product Owner, la relación con equipos comerciales y de operaciones para entender sus procesos, retos y necesidades en profundidad.
Resolución Proactiva: Apoyar en la resolución de desafíos de reportería y análisis, impulsando las mejores prácticas en el uso y consumo de datos con una mirada crítica.




Requisitos imprescindibles:

Experiencia: 4 años de experiencia laboral reciente como Data Analyst, con uso avanzado de Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Mentalidad: Perfil proactivo y crítico. Buscamos a alguien que aporte valor resolviendo problemas, no solo entregando reportes.
Habilidades Blendas: Comodidad y experiencia reuniéndose directamente con equipos de negocio para traducir sus necesidades en soluciones de datos.
Presencialidad: Es imprescindible residir en Barcelona o alrededores y tener disponibilidad para el modelo híbrido (1 día presencial/semana).
Idiomas: Español e Inglés avanzado (deseable).




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido con BCNC Group.
Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos estratégicos dentro de un sector dinámico.
Entorno de trabajo innovador con tecnologías avanzadas.
Plan de desarrollo y formación continua.




¿Esta oportunidad encaja contigo?

¡Postula ahora mismo o comparte este anuncio con la persona que creas que podría ser perfecta para el equipo!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. 



With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Want to use data intelligently to deliver maximum value to clients? It's a challenge that suits you perfectly and energizes you. You're looking for challenges where you can not only advise but also deliver tangible results. You want to make a difference. Are you ready for the next phase? Ready to tackle and solve complex data challenges and further specialize in your data management field? Then we'd love to get to know you.



What you'll be doing at the client's site



As a Data Analyst, you'll play a key role with our clients. You'll advise on their data management, develop data strategies, and translate these into workable solutions to maximize the value of their data. You'll be involved in all phases of the project, from developing data governance frameworks to implementing data quality processes and advising on data analysis. Interested in a project like this?



Moreover:



You'll identify improvement opportunities through thorough analyses of data sources and processes.
You'll design and implement data architecture and models for improved interoperability and scalability.
You'll ensure more efficient and effective systems; you'll advise and support data integration, migration, and transformation projects.
You'll provide insights that support your clients in making the right business decisions.
You'll provide training and support to users to help them manage and use data effectively.


Qualifications



This is you



You're naturally curious, enjoy a bit of fun, but are also deadly serious when it comes to the content. Sound familiar? Great, that's what we appreciate in a colleague. Furthermore, in this role, we'd like you to:



Enjoy your work!
Enjoy collaborating with colleagues and clients on interesting issues. In fact, that's a key part of your job.
You want to develop yourself every day with your positive attitude and drive.
You have strong communication skills and, above all, understand the importance of listening. To the client, colleagues, and of course, yourself!
You don't do the same thing every day; you prefer diverse and complex projects.
You do what you promise. You're accurate and ensure your work is completed on time, without compromising on quality.
You're a true team player. As a Precedencial, you can always count on support from your colleagues. Achievements are the result of successful collaboration, and we celebrate them together! We value this culture highly. What you bring

What you bring



Completed HBO (higher professional education) or WO (university education) degree
You speak fluent Dutch and English
At least one year of knowledge and experience with (meta)data management and data quality solutions
You possess relevant data and technical skills, such as data cleaning, data visualization, machine learning, knowledge of big data tools, and data warehousing. Knowledge of programming languages ​is a plus!Y
ou have a strong vision for data management within organizations.W

hat do we offer?C



ompetitive salary with extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonusesT
raining plan to develop yourself as an expert in your disciplineY
ou have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our offices in Amsterdam or MaastrichtW
orking in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the worldA


dditional InformationU



nfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position. S



ia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs. S



ia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs. S



ia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Au sein de l’équipe Products Systems Engineering, rattaché à l’agence de Vitrolles vous occuperez le rôle Data Analyst H/F.

Dans le cadre de l'analyse des données, vous êtes en charge de l'automatisation des processus pour fournir des solutions efficaces et des visualisations claires.

Missions


Identifier les données pertinentes, définir le problème avec les instruments métiers, et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Implémenter des scripts pour extraire, transformer, charger (ETL), et fusionner des données complexes.
Structurer le code, créer des bases de données et schémas (ex. diagrammes UML), et garantir une solution durable.
Réaliser des analyses quantitatives et qualitatives, proposer des dashboards interactifs, et synthétiser les résultats.
Identifier des pistes d’amélioration, formuler des propositions, et travailler sur le développement d’outils avec les équipes informatiques.


Profil


De formation BAC+5 en data science, mathématique.
Vous avez une expérience significative de 5 années dans un poste similaire.
Vous disposez d’un niveau opérationnel en anglais.
Vous faites preuves d’un esprit d’analyse, de rigueur et d’une aisance relationnelle.
La maitrise des bases de données SQL et NoSQL / des langages : Data Science : Python, R, SQL, etc
La maitrise des outils de BI : Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, etc / des environnements cloud GCP, Azure ou Aws


Rémunération Et Avantages


Politique interne sur le télétravail
CSE (chèque vacances, culture, subvention pratique sportive, etc).
13 RTT + un compte épargne temps
Carte de tickets restaurant
Prévoyance Santé
Prime de vacances
Prime de cooptation
Contribution au remboursement de vos titres de transport en commun ou forfait à la mobilité durable
Salaire à partir de 40 000€ brut annuel suivant votre expertise


Notre Process De Recrutement


Vous candidatez,
Premier échange téléphonique avec notre équipe recrutement,
Un entretien avec votre futur manager et votre chargé de recrutement en agence ou en visio
Si validation, envoi de la proposition de collaboration
Début de votre parcours d’intégration chez Expleo !


A bientôt dans nos équipes !

La localisation des postes n’est qu’indicative, une mobilité géographique sur le territoire national peut être requise.

A compétences égales, une attention particulière sera accordée aux candidatures des travailleurs handicapés et autres bénéficiaires de l'obligation d'emploi de l'article L. 5212-2 du code du travail. »

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez,
Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN,
Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions.
Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
¿Te apasionan los viajes🛫, la cultura🗽, el ocio🎡 y tienes ganas de participar en el crecimiento de la empresa Nº 1 en servicios turísticos en español? Nuestro equipo no para de crecer y buscamos personas con talento e ilusión por desarrollarse. Somos un equipo joven, multicultural e innovador que entiende cada día como un desafío y una nueva oportunidad para crecer junto con la empresa.

Como Data Analyst Intern en Civitatis, aprenderás a transformar grandes volúmenes de datos en insights accionables que impulsen la toma de decisiones en el Departamento de Data y Estrategia y en toda la organización. Tu rol será clave para garantizar que Civitatis continúe siendo líder en el mercado de actividades turísticas, utilizando el análisis de datos para innovar y superar las expectativas de nuestros viajeros 🚀.

Las prácticas tendrán una jornada de 35h o 39h a la semana en horario de mañana.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?


Diseñar, mantener y optimizar consultas SQL para extracción y transformación de datos financieros.
Desarrollar y mantener reportes y dashboards con herramientas como Tableau o PowerBI.
Desarrollar análisis avanzados utilizando Python integrando datos financieros y operativos.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de IT para asegurar la calidad y accesibilidad de los datos.
Proponer y ejecutar mejoras en los procesos de recopilación y análisis de datos.


¿Qué buscamos?


Título universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática o campo relacionado.
Formación específica en análisis de datos y visualización de datos.
Conocimientos en programación (Python, R) y análisis estadístico.
Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python
Experiencia con herramientas de BI como PowerBI o Tableau.
Experiencia trabajando con grandes bases de datos y sistemas de almacenamiento de datos.
Curiosidad y muchas ganas de aprender cosas nuevas
Fuerte capacidad para traducir análisis complejos en recomendaciones claras y accionables


¿Por qué Civitatis?


Formarás parte del líder mundial de reserva online de excursiones y visitas guiadas en español💃🏽.
Espíritu joven, viajero y gran ambiente de trabajo. ¡20 nacionalidades🌏🌎!
Hay vida más allá del trabajo: Flexibilidad horaria (gestionas tu horario de entrada y salida), jornada intensiva de verano, modalidad de trabajo hibrida (días en nuestra oficina de Gran vía y desde casa), así como otras medidas de conciliación.
Eventos de teambuilding 🎉 (tours, concursos, actividades deportivas, etc.)
Planes voluntarios de retribución flexible para sacar el máximo partido a tu salario.
Nunca dejarás de aprender. Planes de desarrollo y formación continua.
¡Equipo sano, equipo feliz! Tenemos fruta siempre a mano 🍌🍊, clases de yoga gratuitas y co-financiamos el gimnasio. 🧘🏽‍♀️🧘🏽‍♀️
Formación en idiomas: Clases de inglés con profesores nativos.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras más de 90.000 actividades con un super descuento.
Trabajarás en el corazón de Madrid. Oficinas junto a la Puerta del Sol.
En Civitatis impulsamos la diversidad y la igualdad de oportunidades, valorando el talento y el potencial de cada persona. Esta oferta está abierta a todas las personas que cumplan con el perfil profesional requerido.


¿Te sumas 🚀?

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Au sein de l’équipe Products Systems Engineering, rattaché à l’agence de Vitrolles vous occuperez le rôle Data Analyst H/F.

Dans le cadre de l'analyse des données, vous êtes en charge de l'automatisation des processus pour fournir des solutions efficaces et des visualisations claires.

Missions


Identifier les données pertinentes, définir le problème avec les instruments métiers, et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Implémenter des scripts pour extraire, transformer, charger (ETL), et fusionner des données complexes.
Structurer le code, créer des bases de données et schémas (ex. diagrammes UML), et garantir une solution durable.
Réaliser des analyses quantitatives et qualitatives, proposer des dashboards interactifs, et synthétiser les résultats.
Identifier des pistes d’amélioration, formuler des propositions, et travailler sur le développement d’outils avec les équipes informatiques.


Profil


De formation BAC+5 en data science, mathématique.
Vous avez une expérience significative de 5 années dans un poste similaire.
Vous disposez d’un niveau opérationnel en anglais.
Vous faites preuves d’un esprit d’analyse, de rigueur et d’une aisance relationnelle.
La maitrise des bases de données SQL et NoSQL / des langages : Data Science : Python, R, SQL, etc
La maitrise des outils de BI : Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, etc / des environnements cloud GCP, Azure ou Aws


Rémunération Et Avantages


Politique interne sur le télétravail
CSE (chèque vacances, culture, subvention pratique sportive, etc).
13 RTT + un compte épargne temps
Carte de tickets restaurant
Prévoyance Santé
Prime de vacances
Prime de cooptation
Contribution au remboursement de vos titres de transport en commun ou forfait à la mobilité durable
Salaire à partir de 40 000€ brut annuel suivant votre expertise


Notre Process De Recrutement


Vous candidatez,
Premier échange téléphonique avec notre équipe recrutement,
Un entretien avec votre futur manager et votre chargé de recrutement en agence ou en visio
Si validation, envoi de la proposition de collaboration
Début de votre parcours d’intégration chez Expleo !


A bientôt dans nos équipes !

La localisation des postes n’est qu’indicative, une mobilité géographique sur le territoire national peut être requise.

A compétences égales, une attention particulière sera accordée aux candidatures des travailleurs handicapés et autres bénéficiaires de l'obligation d'emploi de l'article L. 5212-2 du code du travail. »

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
A TUA MISSÃO

Na Jerónimo Martins procuramos um Business Intelligence Analyst para integrar a nossa equipa do Recheio, com o objetivo de transformar o modelo de reporting e automação de processos




O QUE VAIS FAZER

Desenvolver dashboards e relatórios dinâmicos em QlikSense e Power BI.
Automatizar processos com Python e SQL para aumentar a eficiência.
Analisar dados financeiros e operacionais com pensamento crítico.
Identificar oportunidades de melhoria e propor soluções com impacto.
Colaborar com diferentes áreas para garantir consistência e integração dos dados.
Manter e evoluir soluções, assegurando a sua escalabilidade e fiabilidade.




O TEU PERFIL

2 a 3 anos de experiência em BI, reporting, automação ou análise de dados.
Capacidade analítica e crítica, com foco no negócio.
Experiência em QlikSense (mandatório) Power BI, Python e SQL.
Espírito colaborativo, autonomia e vontade de aprender num ambiente dinâmico.




QUEM SOMOS E O QUE PODES ESPERAR DE NÓS

Porque é que trabalhar connosco é diferente? Porque aqui, as pessoas estão no centro de tudo o que fazemos. Ao integrares a nossa equipa terás acesso a:

22 dias de férias + 2 dias*
Políticas de compensação competitivas
Oportunidades de formação e desenvolvimento
Ginásio, cabeleireiro e estética, cantina, clínica médica, nutrição e outras iniciativas de bem estar
Iniciativas de apoio familiar, saúde e educação e acesso a protocolos

* mediante cumprimento de critérios de absentismo.




Sabe mais acerca de como é trabalhar no Grupo Jerónimo Martins através do nosso website ou página de LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
excelia é uma empresa multinacional de Consultoria, Tecnologia e Serviços Profissionais com mais de 25 anos de experiência. Prestamos serviços em mais de 50 países da Europa, América Latina e Estados Unidos a partir dos nossos 10 escritórios próprios.




Tens experiência como Data Analyst e procuras um novo desafio? Então esta oportunidade é para ti!




🔹 Posição: Data Analyst

📍 Localização: Alfragide (Regime híbrido, 3x por semana no escritório)




🔹Principais tarefas a desenvolver:

✔Colaborar com as partes interessadas dos diversos setores para identificar e entender suas necessidades e desafios analíticos específicos.

✔Mapear os requisitos de negócio para as funcionalidades do produto de analytics existente, identificando oportunidades de melhoria e personalização.

✔Desenvolver e manter dashboards e relatórios usando o Power BI para fornecer insights acionáveis.

✔Garantir a qualidade e a integridade dos dados utilizados para a análise.

✔Fornecer formação e suporte para os utilizadores finais, garantindo uma adoção eficaz das soluções de analytics.

✔Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com as equipas de desenvolvimento de produtos para comunicar as necessidades dos utilizadores e influenciar a estratégia de produto.




🔹 Requisitos Obrigatórios:

✔Licenciatura em Estatística, Matemática, Ciências da Computação ou áreas relacionadas.

✔Mínimo de 2 anos de experiência em análise de dados.

✔Proficiência no desenvolvimento de dashboards e relatórios.

✔Conhecimento em desenvolvimento de modelos tabulares será valorizado.

✔Capacidade de traduzir necessidades de negócios em especificações técnicas.

✔Excelentes habilidades de comunicação e apresentação, com a habilidade de se comunicar eficazmente em todos os níveis da organização.

✔Forte pensamento crítico e habilidades de resolução de problemas.

✔Capacidade de trabalhar de forma independente e em equipe.

✔Domínio de inglês falado e escrito.




🔹 Requisitos Desejáveis:

✔Experiência em linguagens de consulta, como SQL.

✔Familiaridade com princípios de business inteligência e práticas de gestão de dados.

✔Domínio de espanhol falado e escrito.







Se achas que podes encaixar, não hesites em candidatar-te a esta oportunidade.😉

Show more
HTML:
excelia é uma empresa multinacional de Consultoria, Tecnologia e Serviços Profissionais com mais de 25 anos de experiência. Prestamos serviços em mais de 50 países da Europa, América Latina e Estados Unidos a partir dos nossos 10 escritórios próprios.


Tens experiência como Data Analyst e procuras um novo desafio? Então esta oportunidade é para ti!


🔹 Posição: Data Analyst

📍 Localização: Alfragide (Regime híbrido, 3x por semana no escritório)


🔹Principais tarefas a desenvolver:

✔Colaborar com as partes interessadas dos diversos setores para identificar e entender suas necessidades e desafios analíticos específicos.

✔Mapear os requisitos de negócio para as funcionalidades do produto de analytics existente, identificando oportunidades de melhoria e personalização.

✔Desenvolver e manter dashboards e relatórios usando o Power BI para fornecer insights acionáveis.

✔Garantir a qualidade e a integridade dos dados utilizados para a análise.

✔Fornecer formação e suporte para os utilizadores finais, garantindo uma adoção eficaz das soluções de analytics.

✔Trabalhar em estreita colaboração com as equipas de desenvolvimento de produtos para comunicar as necessidades dos utilizadores e influenciar a estratégia de produto.


🔹 Requisitos Obrigatórios:

✔Licenciatura em Estatística, Matemática, Ciências da Computação ou áreas relacionadas.

✔Mínimo de 2 anos de experiência em análise de dados.

✔Proficiência no desenvolvimento de dashboards e relatórios.

✔Conhecimento em desenvolvimento de modelos tabulares será valorizado.

✔Capacidade de traduzir necessidades de negócios em especificações técnicas.

✔Excelentes habilidades de comunicação e apresentação, com a habilidade de se comunicar eficazmente em todos os níveis da organização.

✔Forte pensamento crítico e habilidades de resolução de problemas.

✔Capacidade de trabalhar de forma independente e em equipe.

✔Domínio de inglês falado e escrito.


🔹 Requisitos Desejáveis:

✔Experiência em linguagens de consulta, como SQL.

✔Familiaridade com princípios de business inteligência e práticas de gestão de dados.

✔Domínio de espanhol falado e escrito.



Se achas que podes encaixar, não hesites em candidatar-te a esta oportunidade.😉

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:


Consumer Engagement
Parts, Accessories & Service Performance
Actionable Insights
Diagnostics & Repair Enhancement
Warranty and Repair Efficiency
Technical Information
Learning Solutions
Sales Performance


Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.

The MSXI Purpose

To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world

The MSXI Mission

To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,

and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions

The MSXI Vision

To enhance every journey in the world of mobility

Job Description

Business Data Analyst

40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

Rome, hybrid

Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

The Role

Responsibilities

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:


Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences


Qualifications

About you

About

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:


3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
Fluent level of English


If you’re ready to make an impact and contribute to our company’s success, apply now!

What’s in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.

In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy


Competitive salary
Company laptop and phone
Lunch voucher


Working Pattern


40 hours per week
Monday – Friday
Rome - hybrid


You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Bon(ne) communiquant(e), vous créez facilement du lien avec les nouvelles personnes que vous rencontrez,
Méthodique, les plans d’action sont dans votre ADN,
Ayant le goût du résultat, avec vous il n’y a pas de problème, il n’y a que des solutions.
Attiré(e) par le challenge, vous souhaitez gagner en compétences au sein d’une équipe originale, ambitieuse et très dynamique ?


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !
