Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Au sein de l’équipe Products Systems Engineering, rattaché à l’agence de Entzheim vous occuperez le rôle Data Analyst H/F.

Dans le cadre de l'analyse des données, vous êtes en charge de l'automatisation des processus pour fournir des solutions efficaces et des visualisations claires.

Missions


Identifier les données pertinentes, définir le problème avec les instruments métiers, et proposer des solutions adaptées.
Implémenter des scripts pour extraire, transformer, charger (ETL), et fusionner des données complexes.
Structurer le code, créer des bases de données et schémas (ex. diagrammes UML), et garantir une solution durable.
Réaliser des analyses quantitatives et qualitatives, proposer des dashboards interactifs, et synthétiser les résultats.
Identifier des pistes d’amélioration, formuler des propositions, et travailler sur le développement d’outils avec les équipes informatiques.


Profil


De formation BAC+5 en data science, mathématique.
Vous avez une expérience significative de 5 années dans un poste similaire.
Vous disposez d’un niveau opérationnel en anglais.
Vous faites preuves d’un esprit d’analyse, de rigueur et d’une aisance relationnelle.
La maitrise des bases de données SQL et NoSQL / des langages : Data Science : Python, R, SQL, etc
La maitrise des outils de BI : Spotfire, Power BI, Tableau, etc / des environnements cloud GCP, Azure ou Aws


Rémunération Et Avantages


Politique interne sur le télétravail
CSE (chèque vacances, culture, subvention pratique sportive, etc).
13 RTT + un compte épargne temps
Carte de tickets restaurant
Prévoyance Santé
Prime de vacances
Prime de cooptation
Contribution au remboursement de vos titres de transport en commun ou forfait à la mobilité durable
Salaire à partir de 40 000€ brut annuel suivant votre expertise


Notre Process De Recrutement


Vous candidatez,
Premier échange téléphonique avec notre équipe recrutement,
Un entretien avec votre futur manager et votre chargé de recrutement en agence ou en visio
Si validation, envoi de la proposition de collaboration
Début de votre parcours d’intégration chez Expleo !


A bientôt dans nos équipes !

La localisation des postes n’est qu’indicative, une mobilité géographique sur le territoire national peut être requise.

A compétences égales, une attention particulière sera accordée aux candidatures des travailleurs handicapés et autres bénéficiaires de l'obligation d'emploi de l'article L. 5212-2 du code du travail. »

Title: Data Analyst (Ads Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Data Analyst (Ads Team)

As an Ads Data Analyst, you’ll play a critical role in analyzing considerable amounts of structured and unstructured data generated by both sides of our advertising platform (advertisers and users) and delivering insights that drive product development, customer success, user experience, and business objectives.

eMAG Ads is a distinct business vertical spanning both sides of the Marketplace, advertisers and customers. It consists of a demand-side suite of campaign, budget, targeting management and reporting tools, and a supply-side array of applications responsible for the real-time bidding, delivery and data collection functions of a cohesive PPC advertising Platform.

What you’ll have to do:


Extract, transform and load raw data from access logs, change data capture systems, databases, datalakes and other sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis on structured and unstructured data.
Derive insights and produce monitoring dashboards, reports, funnels and visualisations.
Produce insights from data related to operational, exploratory, hypothesis driven and experimental objectives.
Work closely with product, development, data platform and data science teams in problem and solution discovery, experiment design and decision making processes.
Understand existing datasets and available data; help design and shape new data collection and processing pipelines for new and existing features.
Monitor data quality, operational and experimental metrics and KPIs.


What makes you a good fit:


Proficient in SQL (capable of executing complex SQL queries); proficient in spreadsheet software such as Excel or Google Spreadsheets.
Experienced in deriving and communicating insights from data (abstract), via reports, visualizations or other modes of presentation (concrete), for a diverse stakeholder audience.
Resourceful, problem-solver.
Having a continuous improvement mindset, in love with the problem, not the solution.
Good communication skills, both written and oral (Romanian, English).
2-3 years of proven experience in a Data Analyst or similar role.


What makes you stand out:


Good command of Python/Jupyter Notebook.
Familiarity with Python libraries for more advanced data analysis and visualizations.
Working statistical knowledge.
Experience with query engines (AWS Athena, GCP Big Query, Impala).
Experience with cloud-based data solutions (AWS, GCP).


What we’ve prepared for you:


Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


#midsenior

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.


Show more

As an Ads Data Analyst, you’ll play a critical role in analyzing considerable amounts of structured and unstructured data generated by both sides of our advertising platform (advertisers and users) and delivering insights that drive product development, customer success, user experience, and business objectives.

eMAG Ads is a distinct business vertical spanning both sides of the Marketplace, advertisers and customers. It consists of a demand-side suite of campaign, budget, targeting management and reporting tools, and a supply-side array of applications responsible for the real-time bidding, delivery and data collection functions of a cohesive PPC advertising Platform.

What you’ll have to do:

  • Extract, transform and load raw data from access logs, change data capture systems, databases, datalakes and other sources.
  • Perform exploratory data analysis on structured and unstructured data.
  • Derive insights and produce monitoring dashboards, reports, funnels and visualisations.
  • Produce insights from data related to operational, exploratory, hypothesis driven and experimental objectives.
  • Work closely with product, development, data platform and data science teams in problem and solution discovery, experiment design and decision making processes.
  • Understand existing datasets and available data; help design and shape new data collection and processing pipelines for new and existing features.
  • Monitor data quality, operational and experimental metrics and KPIs.

What makes you a good fit:

  • Proficient in SQL (capable of executing complex SQL queries); proficient in spreadsheet software such as Excel or Google Spreadsheets.
  • Experienced in deriving and communicating insights from data (abstract), via reports, visualizations or other modes of presentation (concrete), for a diverse stakeholder audience.
  • Resourceful, problem-solver.
  • Having a continuous improvement mindset, in love with the problem, not the solution.
  • Good communication skills, both written and oral (Romanian, English).
  • 2-3 years of proven experience in a Data Analyst or similar role.

What makes you stand out:

  • Good command of Python/Jupyter Notebook.
  • Familiarity with Python libraries for more advanced data analysis and visualizations.
  • Working statistical knowledge.
  • Experience with query engines (AWS Athena, GCP Big Query, Impala).
  • Experience with cloud-based data solutions (AWS, GCP).

What we’ve prepared for you:

  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.

#midsenior

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Credit Risk Data Control Analyst
Description:
We offer:




The chance to work in the Risk department of one of the world's top tier Financial Institutions and gain first-hand insight into our business
A supportive and vibrant multinational environment
An endless amount of interesting, complex business challenges
A chance to influence a talent agenda that impacts over 80K employees
A collegial atmosphere to deliver innovative solutions supported by a world-class team
An opportunity to drive true, global business change
Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley
Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




Understand credit risk, credit risk management processes and procedures, credit risk systems and credit data flow
Run, enhance and implement credit data quality control processes
Support credit professionals in the monitoring of Morgan Stanley’s credit exposure against pre-defined policy limits
Assist the team in meeting Regulatory Reporting requirements such as BIS and CCAR
Maintain an ongoing dialogue and act as a liaison between Credit Department, IT and Business Units in resolving identified data quality issues




You have:




2+ years of relevant experience
Interest in risk management and finance involving data analysis and process management
Undergraduate degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or Engineering related areas
Self motivator and team player with strong interpersonal skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage dynamic priorities with attention to details and ability to deliver quality work in a fast-paced environment
Good proficiency with SQL and/or VBA and/or Microsoft Office is a plus (including Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)




Team profile:




The Credit Risk Data Control, comprised of ~15 employees in Budapest, and colleagues in the New York and Mumbai office, plays a pivotal role in credit risk analysis and limits monitoring of the Credit Risk Department in Morgan Stanley. The team is also responsible for credit data management, credit policy/procedure implementation, portfolio and single name monitoring and process change management.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modeling, Finance, Risk Management and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube.

You will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality.

Title: Analyst, Data Analysis
Description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team at ICE. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex financial datasets, identifying trends, and overseeing the collection and maintenance of critical data assets.

This role demands analytical abilities, proficiency with leading data analysis tools, and strong communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The Data Analyst will be tasked with Investments Funds and Warrants-Certificates reference data analysis, data management and standardization, sources research in order to set up wide financial reference datasets in proprietary systems.

Additionally, the candidate will be asked to establish and nurture relationships with Investments Funds and Warrant-Certificates issuers across Europe and, when required, in non-European regions. Among the duties there is the setup of issuing documents flows (KIDs, Factsheets, reporting and regulations Templates).

The candidate should proactively identify opportunities to optimize processes related to data entry and loading through the implementation of dedicated tools.

Furthermore, the role involves providing support to both Italian and international Clients by offering clear explanations and guidance regarding data standardization, content, frequency, and updates. The successful candidate will be instrumental in ensuring high data quality and supporting strategic business initiatives through actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to support business objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver insights.
Perform data validation and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Utilize statistical methods to analyze financial data.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of data-driven strategies and initiatives.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and financial services.


Knowledge And Experience


Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Banking or Statistic and Data Science and related field.
Previous experience in data analysis, preferably in the financial sector would be an asset.
Experience with data modeling, statistical analysis is a plus.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data analysis software.
Knowledge of regulatory requirements and compliance in the financial industry is a plus
Fluent in Italian and English
Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze complex datasets and derive meaningful insights.
Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R (preferably knowledge of data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI).
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and attention to detail in data analysis and reporting.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically.
Team Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with various departments is a must.
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing business needs and priorities.

Title: Startup Founder 2025-2026
Description:
This is not your typical job ad, it’s a unique opportunity to meet your future co-founder(s) and build a startup from scratch.

About Us

Vento is a venture capital firm backed by Exor, one of Europe’s leading investment companies, and the team behind Italian Tech Week, one of the continent’s most influential tech events. Over the past three years, we’ve invested in more than 130 startups and built over 30 from the ground up through our Venture Building program.

What is the Vento Venture Building Program?

Our program connects talented individuals, forms strong founding teams, explores new market opportunities, and helps build high-potential startups from the ground up. We’re looking for ambitious, driven people ready to fully commit to the founder journey.

How It Works


The program is a 6-month, full-time experience starting January 2026 in Turin, designed for those ready to take the leap and build a startup from scratch.
In the first three months, each selected founder receives a €3,750 grant to focus entirely on team formation, problem exploration, and market validation.
The first weeks are dedicated to getting to know each other through business case workshops, group activities, and market challenges developed with industry experts.
Teams of 2–3 people are formed based on complementary skills, motivation, and personal chemistry.
After team formation, you’ll move through fast-paced, iterative cycles of problem exploration, ideation, implementation, and testing. Speed and iteration are key.
Each team receives ongoing support: weekly check-ins, vertical and horizontal mentorship, and access to founders and investors through events and informal gatherings.


Investment

After three months, each team pitches to the Vento Investment Committee. If your team and idea are deemed investable, Vento will invest €80,000 for 10% equity. The journey concludes with the Investor Day at Italian Tech Week, where you’ll present your startup to leading funds and angel investors from across Europe.

Who We’re Looking For

We seek talented individuals with drive, clarity of thought, ambition, and execution skills. We’ve selected philosophers, architects, engineers, lawyers, and experienced operators. What matters is your willingness to build and your readiness to go all in.

You don’t need an idea or a team to apply, our structure focuses on people first and their ability to explore new markets and problems.

Key Dates


Applications open: Now until October 12, 2025
Bootcamp (in-person): Choose between the first session (November 29–December 2, 2025) or the second session (December 6–10, 2025)
Program kickoff: January 26, 2026
Investment Committee: May 2026
Investor Day: Italian Tech Week, September/October 2026 (dates TBD)


Apply by October 12th, 2025

P.S. We love AI. Just not for this part, let’s keep it real!

Title: Aftersales Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Aftersales Data Analytics Internship




At BMW Group Hellas, we are looking for a motivated and eager Data Analytics Intern to join our team. We value each member’s enthusiasm and teamwork as we work towards our strategic goals.

As a Data Analytics Intern, you will have the opportunity to gain practical experience in analyzing key business data, supporting reporting processes, and assisting in various projects related to dealer performance and Aftersales operations. This internship is a great way to develop your skills in data analysis, visualization, and business support, laying a strong foundation for your future career in data and business analytics.




What Awaits You?

Support Aftersales projects and performance tracking.
Help analyze KPIs and Dealers reports.
Provide data for operational needs.
Assist with Dealer bonuse processing and reporting.
Contribute to Power BI dashboards.
Support pricing updates and campaigns.
Help in meetings with suppliers.
Monitor market trends for improvements.




What Should You Bring?

Currently enrolled or recently graduated from a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Sciences, Business Analytics, or related field.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Knowledge of data processing, visualization, and reporting tools.
Knowledge of Python programming, Power BI, and RPA is a plus.
Fluent in English.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Keen interested in the automotive business and data.




What do we offer you?

With us, you are guaranteed to find challenging and versatile opportunities to actively shape the sustainable mobility of the future. In addition to the motivating working environment in our dynamic teams, we offer a wide range of benefits:

Fixed-term contract.
Hands-on experience in data analysis, reporting, and project support.
Exposure to the inner workings of a dynamic organization.
A flexible working environment.




Are you interested?

If you are passionate about data analysis and eager to gain practical experience, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity.




After the screening of all the CVs received, we will only contact the candidates who meet the requirements of the job to arrange an interview. All applications are considered strictly confidential.

Title: Data & Analytics Graduate Programme
Description:
About Allianz

We are proud to be one of the world’s most trusted insurance companies, with a workforce as diverse as the world itself. As the trusted insurance partner to over 700,000 customers across Ireland, we have built a brand based on trust, integrity and outstanding customer service for over 100 years and our success is primarily down to the incredible people we employ.

We strive to deliver fantastic customer experiences through innovative thinking, state of the art technology, excellent training, outstanding customer service, dedication and team work. As an employer, we truly care for our employees and their individual needs and aspirations. With this in mind we have tailored our work approach to ensure you the flexibility and support needed to excel in your role. While the role is officially based in Elm Park, Dublin 4, the team work within a hybrid working model.




We are incredibly proud to be recognised as a Great Place to Work having won the Super Large Category during the 2025 Awards, as well as being one of Ireland’s Best Workplaces for Women in 2025! We are also the proud winners of the Gradireland 2022, 2023, 2024 & 2025 ‘Best Graduate Recruiter within the Insurance industry’! If you're ready to take the next step in your career, apply now and become part of the team







The Data & Analytics Graduate Programme




With commitment to putting customers at the centre of our business, we look to identify those with integrity, leadership, positivity and ambition to be the best they can possible be in their career. We are looking for graduates who want to blaze new trails, improve the insurance industry and shape a better tomorrow.

The Data & Analytics Graduate Programme is a three-year programme where graduates will have the opportunity to work in technical functions of Claims, Data Insights, Actuarial, Underwriting Teams and Portfolio Underwriting.

Alongside achieving relevant professional qualifications (APA certification), you will experience four rotations tailored to your interests and capabilities, including a 6 month international assignment in one of our global entities.

For more information download our Graduate Programme Brochure







Rewards & Benefits




International Assignment
Further Educational Support & Additional Study Leave
22 Annual Leave Days plus 2 company days
Staff Affinity Insurance Scheme
Excellent Pension Benefits
Hybrid Working Arrangements
Free Lunch
Onsite Gym
Holiday Saving Scheme & Travel Subsidies
Employee Assistance Programme
Active Social Club & Events
Charity and community initiatives and Volunteering days
Mentorship Programme
Additional Learning & Development Support










What we are looking for




Data driven with an analytical mindset, utilising Artificial Intelligence for enhanced insights
Excellent problem solving capabilities
Results oriented & solutions focused
Ability to work towards project deadlines in a multi-disciplinary environment
Commitment to gaining further educational qualifications










Minimum requirements




Achieved or expected 2:1 in Actuarial Studies, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Insurance or related disciplines
Hold full authorisation to work in Ireland or hold a valid work permit for minimum of 36 month period
Demonstrated work experience or internship experience










Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.




We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.

Title: Senior Client Data & Analytics Lead
Description:
Help us use technology to make a big green dent in the universe!




Kraken powers some of the most innovative global developments in energy.




We’re a technology company focused on creating a smart, sustainable energy system. From optimising renewable generation, creating a more intelligent grid and enabling utilities to provide excellent customer experiences, our operating system for energy is transforming the industry around the world in a way that benefits everyone.




It’s a really exciting time in energy. Help us make a real impact on shaping a better, more sustainable future. 




Kraken Customer




What we do: build the most AI-driven, innovative, forward-thinking platform for energy management. From optimizing resources to delivering cost-effective, exceptional customer experiences through advanced Customer Information Systems (CIS), billing, meter data management, CRM, and AI-driven communications, Kraken is powering the next wave of innovation in the energy industry.




Why we do it: future energy will not look like energy as we know it today. We need to not just think about our future, but build for it. Now.




Who are we looking for?




We’re looking for an influential data and analytics leader who’s excited to work directly with clients — helping them build modern data capabilities, coach on data best practices, and help them get transformative from Kraken data. 

You should bring experience leading a high-performing analytics or data team; a love of working with clients; and a passion for driving the clean energy transition. (Energy experience nice-to-have, but not required.)




The role

You’ll work directly with Kraken clients to help them develop modern, transformative data and analytics capabilities as part of their broader Kraken transformation.




You’ll:

- Guide them as they rebuild critical reporting & analytics on Kraken data

- Coach client teams on “what good looks like” in analytics practices — including roles, tools, and processes.

- Occasionally get hands-on with sample SQL or BI to help unblock or demonstrate.

- Translate client needs into clear input for Kraken product and engineering

- You won’t be an implementation manager or a full-time analyst. This is a hybrid role: part coach, part practitioner, part translator — helping clients both adopt Kraken data smoothly and build lasting data capabilities to drive their transformation. Perfect for someone with strong data leadership chops who wants more client face-time and a high-impact role. 

- This is one of the first hires onto a new client-facing data team, giving you a chance to play a strategic role in establishing vision, practices, and playbook.







PLEASE SEND YOUR CV IN ENGLISH




What you’ll do:
Guide clients in redefining critical reporting and analytics to use new Kraken data and concepts, through working sessions, trainings, and occasional SQL/BI examples
Coach client data teams on best practices and help them spot gaps in skills, roles, tools, or process
Help clients identify reporting & analytics outcomes they need Kraken to drive and partner with product to deliver these 
Train Kraken’s broader client delivery team on how to ask effective data questions and leverage data to drive business impact





What you’ll need to have / be:
8+ years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence or related field (e.g., analytics manager or director, data consultant, lead data analyst, analytics engineer)
Familiarity with SQL and modern BI tools – enough to recognize and speak to what “good” looks like & construct examples
Excellent communications, collaboration and presentation skills
Strong grasp of modern data practices (team structure, tools, ways of working)
Experience working in an agile, product-led context
Excitement for a fast-paced, high-autonomy, fun environment
Strong influencing skills and ability to challenge traditional ways of thinking
For senior roles: Experience leading data teams

HTML:
Help us use technology to make a big green dent in the universe!


Kraken powers some of the most innovative global developments in energy.


We’re a technology company focused on creating a smart, sustainable energy system. From optimising renewable generation, creating a more intelligent grid and enabling utilities to provide excellent customer experiences, our operating system for energy is transforming the industry around the world in a way that benefits everyone.


It’s a really exciting time in energy. Help us make a real impact on shaping a better, more sustainable future. 


Kraken Customer


What we do: build the most AI-driven, innovative, forward-thinking platform for energy management. From optimizing resources to delivering cost-effective, exceptional customer experiences through advanced Customer Information Systems (CIS), billing, meter data management, CRM, and AI-driven communications, Kraken is powering the next wave of innovation in the energy industry.


Why we do it: future energy will not look like energy as we know it today. We need to not just think about our future, but build for it. Now.


Who are we looking for?


We’re looking for an influential data and analytics leader who’s excited to work directly with clients — helping them build modern data capabilities, coach on data best practices, and help them get transformative from Kraken data. 

You should bring experience leading a high-performing analytics or data team; a love of working with clients; and a passion for driving the clean energy transition. (Energy experience nice-to-have, but not required.)


The role

You’ll work directly with Kraken clients to help them develop modern, transformative data and analytics capabilities as part of their broader Kraken transformation.


You’ll:

- Guide them as they rebuild critical reporting & analytics on Kraken data

- Coach client teams on “what good looks like” in analytics practices — including roles, tools, and processes.

- Occasionally get hands-on with sample SQL or BI to help unblock or demonstrate.

- Translate client needs into clear input for Kraken product and engineering

- You won’t be an implementation manager or a full-time analyst. This is a hybrid role: part coach, part practitioner, part translator — helping clients both adopt Kraken data smoothly and build lasting data capabilities to drive their transformation. Perfect for someone with strong data leadership chops who wants more client face-time and a high-impact role. 

- This is one of the first hires onto a new client-facing data team, giving you a chance to play a strategic role in establishing vision, practices, and playbook.



PLEASE SEND YOUR CV IN ENGLISH


What you’ll do:
  • Guide clients in redefining critical reporting and analytics to use new Kraken data and concepts, through working sessions, trainings, and occasional SQL/BI examples
  • Coach client data teams on best practices and help them spot gaps in skills, roles, tools, or process
  • Help clients identify reporting & analytics outcomes they need Kraken to drive and partner with product to deliver these 
  • Train Kraken’s broader client delivery team on how to ask effective data questions and leverage data to drive business impact


What you’ll need to have / be:
  • 8+ years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence or related field (e.g., analytics manager or director, data consultant, lead data analyst, analytics engineer)
  • Familiarity with SQL and modern BI tools – enough to recognize and speak to what “good” looks like & construct examples
  • Excellent communications, collaboration and presentation skills
  • Strong grasp of modern data practices (team structure, tools, ways of working)
  • Experience working in an agile, product-led context
  • Excitement for a fast-paced, high-autonomy, fun environment
  • Strong influencing skills and ability to challenge traditional ways of thinking
  • For senior roles: Experience leading data teams

Title: Client Data & Analytics Lead
Description:
Help us use technology to make a big green dent in the universe!




Kraken powers some of the most innovative global developments in energy.




We’re a technology company focused on creating a smart, sustainable energy system. From optimising renewable generation, creating a more intelligent grid and enabling utilities to provide excellent customer experiences, our operating system for energy is transforming the industry around the world in a way that benefits everyone.




It’s a really exciting time in energy. Help us make a real impact on shaping a better, more sustainable future. 




Kraken Customer




What we do: build the most AI-driven, innovative, forward-thinking platform for energy management. From optimizing resources to delivering cost-effective, exceptional customer experiences through advanced Customer Information Systems (CIS), billing, meter data management, CRM, and AI-driven communications, Kraken is powering the next wave of innovation in the energy industry.




Why we do it: future energy will not look like energy as we know it today. We need to not just think about our future, but build for it. Now.




Who are we looking for?




We’re looking for a brilliant senior Data & Analytics Client Delivery Lead to help clients fully leverage Kraken data and transform their data team and capabilities. You should bring extensive experience doing analytics on a strong, modern data team (e.g., data analytics, business intelligence, or related field -- analytics manager, lead data analyst, analytics or data consultant or similar); a love of working with clients; and a passion for driving the clean energy transition – energy sector experience is a plus!




The role




You’ll work directly with Kraken clients to help them develop modern, transformative data and analytics capabilities as part of their broader Kraken transformation. You’ll train them on Kraken data and support them in building critical reporting & insightful analytics, sometimes getting hands-on with query writing or demo analytics. 




You’ll also leverage your experience leading strong analytics teams to advise senior client data leadership on how to build a high-performing, business-centric data organization and leverage data as a strategic asset to unlock ambitious business and clean energy goals.




We are a flat and agile organisation and plan to remain this way. We are looking for a hands-on Data & Analytics Client Delivery Lead that can support both directly and indirectly - sometimes jumping in and writing queries or solving data challenges and other times advising or upskilling both clients and colleagues. 




You will play a critical role in ensuring the clients’ reporting and analytics transition to Kraken goes smoothly - and ensuring that clients build the transformative data capabilities needed to get full value from Kraken data and power aspirational business goals.




What you’ll do:
Guide clients in redefining critical reporting and analytics to use new Kraken data and concepts, through hands-on query writing, working sessions, and trainings
Advise clients, including senior leadership, on topics like how to develop a high-performing data organization, how to build a modern tech stack, and how to pursue a data strategy and priorities that drive their core business objectives
Strategically define and prioritize client data needs to influence the data product roadmap, ensuring product understands the core, shared client needs and that solutions achieve clients’ desired business outcomes
Partner with engineering to deliver new data features and requirements aligned to client use cases
Train Kraken’s broader client delivery team on how to help their respective business domains ask effective data questions and leverage data directly to drive business impact





What you’ll need to have / be:
Degree qualified equivalent, with strong client delivery and/or product ownership experience
Several years of experience as a data analytics, business intelligence, or related field -- analytics manager, lead data analyst, analytics or data consultant or similar
Strong familiarity with modern data practices and tools
Strong facility with SQL and modern BI toolsFamiliar with agile product development practices and experience collaborating with engineering
Excellent communications, collaboration and presentation skills
Strong influencing skills and ability to challenge traditional ways of thinking
Patience – our clients are undergoing huge transformations that take time and require our understanding
Experience in the energy sector a plus








Kraken is a certified Great Place to Work in France, Germany, Spain, Japan and Australia. In the UK we are one of the Best Workplaces on Glassdoor with a score of 4.7. Check out our Welcome to the Jungle site (FR/EN) to learn more about our teams and culture.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Ardanis is currently looking for a Data Engineer to support a client in the hospitality sector in the UK. The role involves collaborating with a small, non-technical internal team to build and refactor a data warehouse, streamline reporting, and improve insights through Power BI. The engagement will begin with on-site presence in the UK for the first few weeks to work directly with the client team. After this initial phase, you can work both hybrid or remote!

Key Responsibilities


Design, build, and refactor a scalable data warehouse solution
Develop and optimize ETL/ELT pipelines for data integration and reliability
Support the enhancement of Power BI dashboards and reports
Train and upskill a small internal team to ensure knowledge transfer
Introduce best practices in data governance, documentation, and reporting


Requirements


Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role
Strong knowledge of data warehouse design, SQL, and ETL/ELT processes
Hands-on experience with Power BI (data modeling, DAX, report optimization)
Ability to collaborate effectively with non-technical stakeholders
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Availability to work on-site in the UK for the first weeks of the project


Nice to Have


Previous experience in the hospitality industry or with transactional/operational data
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP)
Knowledge of data governance and compliance standards


If you're ready to shape the future, join us!

Title: Junior Analysts to M&A Deal Advisory - Aug 2026
Description:
Deloitte is a global leader in Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal and Consultative Services. With more than 450,000 employees in over 150 countries, we help our clients and our communities solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals through domain and industry expertise, global reach and alliances with the largest tech providers. What defines Deloitte is our drive to make a meaningful difference. For us, this means long-term development and results for our clients and their companies, ideas and actions that also contribute to positive societal development. It is also about empowering our people and promoting their development.




Job Description



At Deloitte Deal Advisory, we help clients maximise the value of their mergers, acquisitions and divestitures across the entire transaction cycle, including the below offerings:




M&A Strategy




Due diligence services, including:




Commercial due diligence




Operational due diligence




IT/Tech due diligence




Carve-out and integration planning and execution




Value Creation Services






Our team combines expertise from strategy, finance, operations and technology to provide tailored, high-quality insights that inform investment and divestiture decisions, as well as post-deal value creation. Operating across the Nordics and in close collaboration with offices across the globe, we work seamlessly to deliver comprehensive solutions during critical phases of the deal lifecycle.




We are seeking Analysts to join our Stockholm office in August 2026. In this role, you will support clients through integration and separation programmes, manage various aspects of the M&A process and engage with stakeholders to optimise deal value. You will conduct high-quality research and analysis, contributing to the delivery of strategic insights. Additionally, you will develop rapport and trust with clients, drive programme management, prepare presentations, facilitate workshops and contribute to business development activities that enhance Deloitte’s market presence across the region.




Qualifications



A successful candidate has the following qualities:




Completed MBA or Master’s degree with strong academic results




Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills




Prior experience in strategy development or any part of the M&A lifecycle is beneficial, e.g., through management consulting or other internships




Ability to work both independently and as part of a team




Flexibility in handling the demands of deal cycles




Proficiency in MS PowerPoint and Excel




Fluency in written and spoken English and preferably Swedish or another Scandinavian language




Can-do attitude, goal-oriented and positive mindset






How you’ll grow




As an Analyst with Deloitte Deal Advisory, you will be an integral part of a dynamic and growing team, contributing to successful mergers and divestitures across a range of industries. You will experience a steep learning curve in management advisory, strategic thinking and change management, with broad exposure to M&A projects in various industries and geographies. Working closely with colleagues, clients and investors worldwide, you will gain valuable international experience.




We are expanding our Deal Advisory practice in Sweden, offering you the opportunity to play a key role in our growth across the Nordics. You will have the freedom to take on responsibility and grow in both client-facing and internal situations, with our full support to help you advance your career. We value honesty and direct communication and foster an inclusive team culture where contributions are recognised.




Additional Information



We offer




As a part of Deloitte, you will gain access to the world’s largest consultancy network, meaning you will have colleagues all over the globe who you can utilise in order to develop yourself, our clients and our business. You will work with exciting and complex projects both on a global and Nordic level within a team that values your perspective. Your personal development and the opportunities that help you grow are of great importance to us. We offer you practical experience, a personal coach and a structured training programme that promotes continuous learning, as well as continuous feedback and guidance from more experienced colleagues.




You will get the opportunity to be part of an organisation where we help our clients on their journey to become a more sustainable organisation. You also get to be involved in our own initiatives relating to climate and environmental work as well as social responsibility.




How to apply




Submit your application online as soon as possible. Your application should contain your:




CV




Cover letter




University grades - the grade document you upload should have been retrieved no more than 2 months ago






In the first step, you upload your CV. In the next step, you upload your university transcripts (for courses completed so far) and cover letter. Please note that you need to submit all the requested documents for your application to be considered completed. Apply as soon as possible as we review applications on an ongoing basis. Upon submitting your application, you should receive a confirmation email from us. If you don't receive this email, we advise you to submit your application again. If you are applying for multiple positions with us, please clarify in your applications which role you are most interested in.




Questions




If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Sophie Karlerö Kolijn, Recruiter, at skarlero@deloitte.se.




As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, in order to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/. For the roles where university grades are requested a verification of the grades is made as a part of the recruitment process. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible recruiter.




What impact will you make?




Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.




Show more

As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, in order to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/. For the roles where university grades are requested a verification of the grades is made as a part of the recruitment process. If you have any questions, please contact the responsible recruiter.


What impact will you make?


Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

Title: Data Analyst (Digital)
Description:
In het kort

We zoeken een gedreven Data Analist in ons Digital Sales & Engagement Consumer team. Ben jij de persoon om onze groei in de Consumer doelgroepen en producten serieus te boosten? Solliciteer dan nu!

Je werk

Als Data Analist verzamel, verrijk en analyseer je alle relevante klantdata. Je onderzoekt complexe vraagstukken aan de hand van interne en externe data en spot kansen om nieuwe klanten aan te trekken en hun digital betrokkenheid en product adoptie te vergroten. Je rapporteert en analyseert de resultaten van onze activiteiten en adviseert de digital marketeers en klant selectie specialisten over optimalisatie kansen. Zo help je het team om de juiste keuzes te maken en acties te ontwikkelen met een maximale impact op de klant en onze doelstellingen. Data is het begin- én eindpunt om te waarborgen dat de klant altijd centraal staat, en dat er wordt gehandeld in het belang van de klant.

Dat doe je met veel vrijheid, maar niet alleen. Je inspireert je teamgenoten en stakeholders om samen een moeiteloze digitale ervaring te ontwikkelen die vernieuwend, goed converterend en klantvriendelijk is. Je werkt in het team direct samen met een digital marketeer, copywriter, visueel ontwerper, conversie optimalisatie specialist, en andere data specialisten.

Wat hoort er concreet bij jouw takenpakket?


De structurele rapportage van de KPI’s van het team
Het verzamelen, verrijken en analyseren van data vanuit interne en externe data bronnen tbv het identificeren en onderzoeken van kansen
in het kader van de doelstellingen van het eigen team en het Consumer segment
ter ondersteuning van bredere onderwerpen binnen Digital Sales & Engagement
ter onderbouwing van bepaalde change / investeringswensen
Het evalueren en visualiseren van campagneresultaten
Samenwerking met analisten uit andere teams om één data waarheid te borgen.
Je neemt actief deel aan de data circle binnen CDX
Bijdragen aan de standaardisatie en automatisering processen, en werkzaamheden, zodat er ruimte ontstaat voor groei.


Een strakke agile (sprint) planning van je werk in overleg (refinement) met het team

Werkomgeving

Digital Sales & Engagement (DS&E) is verantwoordelijk voor het genereren van inkomsten via digitale kanalen en het ondersteunen van klanten in alle segmenten gedurende de digitale klantreis met een One Bank aanpak. Het DS&E Consumer team is verantwoordelijk voor de digitale groei van het aantal klanten binnen het strategisch belangrijke Consumer klantsegment en hun digitale betrokkenheid. We bereiken dit door gerichte campagnes en klantreizen te ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de specifieke behoeften van de strategische doelgroepen binnen dit segment, zoals jongeren, studenten, young professionals, en Expats. Daarnaast is het DS&E Consumer team verantwoordelijk voor de digitale verkoop en adoptie van de producten Betalen, Verzekeren, en Lenen. Die product verantwoordelijkheid dragen wij over alle klantsegmenten heen. Al deze activiteiten dragen bij aan de verbetering van de kosten/inkomsten-ratio.

Het Consumer team is een multidisciplinair team, waarin je alle expertises om je heen hebt om ideeën van A tot Z uit te werken en uit te voeren. Denk aan copy & content specialisten, data analisten, een conversie optimalisatie specialist, een visueel designer, en andere digital marketeers. Binnen dit team rapporteer je aan de Consumer Lead. Je collega's hebben digitaal in hun dna en nemen hun werk en onze klanten zeer serieus. Onze digital sales & engagement ambities op de klantgroepen zijn hoog, dus we zoeken een slimme team member met de drive to succeed die altijd zijn of haar A-game brengt.

Je profiel

Je bent servicegericht, creatief, kritisch, ondernemend, en zorgvuldig. Je voert niet enkel uit, maar denkt graag actief mee vanuit de doelen van het bedrijf en die van het team. Jouw drive is om in een concurrerend online speelveld het verschil te maken. Ook begrijp je hoe je met stakeholders omgaat in een veranderende omgeving en neem je je collega’s mee in een servicegerichte en data-driven werkwijze. Als het om analyse en selectie expertise gaat, ben je een voorbeeld voor je collega's.

Hard skills


WO werk- en denkniveau, met minimaal vijf jaar ervaring in een commerciële en analytische, functie;
Kennis van en ervaring met statistische software pakketten, database en selectietechnieken (SQL/R/Python/Google Analytics 4);
Kennis van en ervaring met dashboarding & reporting (Power BI)
Teamplayer, gewend aan werken in multidisciplinair commercieel team
Bekendheid met agile werkvormen.



Verder ben je


Analytisch: Jij onderzoekt liefst complexe zaken, ontleedt ze in kleinere delen, legt verbanden, onderzoekt alternatieve acties, en bepaalt de weg vooruit.
Commercieel: Jij spot commerciële kansen en zet ze om in concrete plannen en acties.
Klant obsessed: Je werkt vanuit een diepgaand begrip van klantbehoeften en klantgedrag. Je richt onze commerciële activiteiten zo in dat de klant wint.
Samenwerkingsgericht: Jij bent gedreven om samen met collega's de beste resultaten te behalen. Je begrijpt dat teamwork de sleutel is tot het realiseren van successen



Wij bieden


Een inspirerende en toekomstgerichte werkomgeving met top specialisten om je heen
Het bruto maandsalaris is op basis van een 36-urige werkweek, inclusief vakantiegeld en benefit budget. Een 40-urige werkweek is ook mogelijk.
Een Hay salaris in schaal 10. Exacte salarisbepaling en salarishoogte is op basis van de kennis, ervaring en het potentieel dat jij meebrengt.
Het benefit budget bedraagt 11% van je salaris. Als je in een maand geen aankopen of reserveringen doet in de Benefit Shop, krijg je over die maand een twaalfde deel van je benefit budget uitbetaald.
Vijf weken vakantie per jaar. Je hebt de mogelijkheid om vier weken per jaar bij te kopen.
Persoonlijk Ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000,- per jaar. Dit bedrag kun je opsparen tot € 3.000,-
Mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken (in overleg met je team).
Een ov-jaarabonnement met gratis openbaar vervoer in heel Nederland.
Een uitstekende pensioenregeling.



Interesse?

Heb je interesse hebben in bovenstaande functie? Solliciteer dan direct! Eventuele vragen kun je stellen aan jeroen.bleijerveld@nl.abnamro.com.

Jouw Toekomst: Inclusief, Innovatief en Duurzaam

Bij ABN AMRO geloven we in "Banking for better, for generations to come." Gelijke kansen voor iedereen vormen een belangrijk fundament, waarbij we streven naar een inclusieve cultuur waarin alle medewerkers zich gezien, gehoord en gewaardeerd voelen. Onze visie als persoonlijke bank in de digitale tijd sluit naadloos aan bij de behoefte aan verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen, voortkomend uit een divers samenspel van culturen en ervaringen. We richten ons op klantbeleving, duurzaamheid en bouwen aan een toekomstbestendige bank, waarbij we gelijke beloning voor gelijk werk jaarlijks onderzoeken om eerlijke kansen te waarborgen. Sluit je aan bij een bank die vindingrijkheid en ambitie omarmt, en maak samen met ons impact voor een betere toekomst.

Als je wilt solliciteren voor het B-Able of Reboot programma, zorg er dan voor dat je dit vermeldt zowel in de titel als in de inhoud van je cv.

Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus

Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om cv's te mogen indienen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.

Wij vragen


Een klantgerichte visie



Wij bieden


Analytische skills

Title: (Junior) Project & Data Analyst - LSCM (m/f/d)
Description:
POSITION SNAPSHOT

JobReq ID: 54144

Type of work: Hybrid

Type of contract: Open-ended/permanent

Full/Part Time: Full time

Location:

Frankfurt am Main, DE

About Us

Bridgestone Americas, Inc. (BSAM), headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, and Bridgestone Europe, Middle East and Africa (BSEMEA), headquartered in Brussels, Belgium, operate collectively as a “Bridgestone West” strategic region. This region services the strategic business needs of teams across the Americas, Europe, Middle East and Africa. BSAM and BSEMEA are subsidiaries of Bridgestone Corporation, globally headquartered in Japan. Bridgestone and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand products and solutions to address the needs of a broad range of customers and industries.

About The Role

We are looking for a (Junior) Project & Data Analyst – LSCM (m/f/d) to join us as soon as possible, supporting data-driven process optimization and project coordination in the field of logistics and supply chain management.

Responsibilities

Project Management Support



Assist in the coordination of supply chain projects across the region.
Help prepare business cases and project documentation.
Support project planning, schedules & resource allocation
Follow up the execution of the project over time : timeline tracking, follow-up on action items, follow up on cost. Monitor and share in a formal, structured way project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies
Ensure smooth communication between stakeholders and maintain project records.
Deliver projects as per plan for scope, time and budget



Operational Support & Process Optimization



Support daily logistics and inventory activities by building, maintaining, and proactively developing simple reports and dashboards. Help ensure the right data is available to support decision-making and improve visibility on key operations.
Work closely with team members to improve how data is shared and reported, making sure tools stay useful and aligned with what the business needs.
Look into supply chain data to spot patterns, issues, or areas where things can be done better, helping the team improve performance.
Help roll out Continuous Improvement (CIP) activities with external partners by tracking progress, following up on actions, and keeping everyone informed. Support updates, involve the right people, and help keep things moving in the right direction.



Required Qualifications And Experience

Education, Master's Degree, Certifications:



University degree in Business, Supply Chain, Engineering, or a related field



Professional Experience:



You have one to two years of experience in a similar role, ideally gained through internships or early career positions



Technical/Functional Skills:



You are proficient in Power BI and Excel
You have experience in visualizing complex datasets and working with large volumes of data
You possess a solid understanding of supply chain processes and basic project management principles



Language Skills:



You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in both German and English



Soft Skills / Behavioral Competencies:



You think analytically, work in a structured manner, and pay close attention to detail
With your proactive and solution-oriented mindset, you contribute actively to the team
You are eager to learn, communicate effectively, and enjoy working in an international environment
Values such as agility, courage, and ownership guide your daily actions



What We Offer

At Bridgestone, what really matter is to foster co-creation opportunities and empowering you to be creative and curious to make mobility safer, more efficient, and more sustainable for future generations. Whatever role you fill, when you represent Bridgestone, you are a valued teammate, and part of our larger mission to “Serve Society with Superior Quality”, for that, we offer you more than just a competitive payment; we will provide you:



A supportive and engaging onboarding experience to ensure a smooth transition into our team.
The opportunity to develop and grow, through training and regular mentorship.
Corporate Social Responsibility activities.
A truly global, dynamic and challenging work environment.
Agility and work/life effectiveness and your long-term well-being.
A diverse and inclusive team.



We are committed to create an even more inclusive culture that advances equity, embraces individuality, and helps our increasingly diverse teammates, customers, and communities thrive, by providing equal opportunities in employment. This means that all job applicants and members of staff will receive equal treatment and that we will not discriminate on grounds of gender, marital status, race, ethnicity, color, nationality, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, religion or age.
Show more

  • A supportive and engaging onboarding experience to ensure a smooth transition into our team.
  • The opportunity to develop and grow, through training and regular mentorship.
  • Corporate Social Responsibility activities.
  • A truly global, dynamic and challenging work environment.
  • Agility and work/life effectiveness and your long-term well-being.
  • A diverse and inclusive team.


We are committed to create an even more inclusive culture that advances equity, embraces individuality, and helps our increasingly diverse teammates, customers, and communities thrive, by providing equal opportunities in employment. This means that all job applicants and members of staff will receive equal treatment and that we will not discriminate on grounds of gender, marital status, race, ethnicity, color, nationality, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, religion or age.

Title: Market Intelligence Internship
Description:
¡Desde Iveco Group España buscamos a una persona para incorporarse dando apoyo a nuestra actividad!




Durante el desarrollo de tu beca tendrás la oportunidad de ser parte de una multinacional líder en el sector de automoción, en la cual podrás formarte y adquirir nuevos conocimientos. Así mismo participarás en la actividad del día a día de Iveco España, apoyando a tu departamento en el área de Market Intelligence and Sales Support, dando soporte en las siguientes funciones:




Extracción, análisis y tratamiento de datos comerciales.
Colaboración en el desarrollo de las campañas comerciales.
Análisis de la competencia: clientes, mercados, producto y posicionamiento.
Propuesta y realización de procedimientos, tareas de mantenimiento, automatización y monitorización de las actividades relacionados con la gestión de las campañas comerciales.




¡¡Y muchas más cosas!!




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Iveco apuesta por la formación, tanto práctica como académica. Es por ello que ponemos a tu disposición la posibilidad de participar en nuestro programa de Beca. Nosotros nos encargamos del convenio de colaboración; tu solo tienes que preocuparte por tu desarrollo personal (académico y profesional). Con esta visión ofrecemos:




Inscripción a cargo de la Compañía en el programa Universitario o de Postgrado de nuestro catálogo durante 18 meses.
Beca de ayuda mensual al estudio por importe de 1100 euros brutos.
Horario de prácticas: 35 horas semanales, repartidas de lunes a jueves de 08:00 a 16:00 h y los viernes de 8:00 a 14:00
Flexibilidad horaria de 2 horas.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo.
Atractivo calendario laboral.
Comedor de Empresa sin coste.




¿ Que estamos buscando?




Haber finalizado o a estar cerca de finalizar tu formación universitaria.
Inglés: nivel medio real tanto oral como escrito (se realizará prueba).
Excel; nivel medio-alto (se realizará prueba).




"Iveco is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status."

Show more
HTML:
¡Desde Iveco Group España buscamos a una persona para incorporarse dando apoyo a nuestra actividad!


Durante el desarrollo de tu beca tendrás la oportunidad de ser parte de una multinacional líder en el sector de automoción, en la cual podrás formarte y adquirir nuevos conocimientos. Así mismo participarás en la actividad del día a día de Iveco España, apoyando a tu departamento en el área de Market Intelligence and Sales Support, dando soporte en las siguientes funciones:


  • Extracción, análisis y tratamiento de datos comerciales.
  • Colaboración en el desarrollo de las campañas comerciales.
  • Análisis de la competencia: clientes, mercados, producto y posicionamiento.
  • Propuesta y realización de procedimientos, tareas de mantenimiento, automatización y monitorización de las actividades relacionados con la gestión de las campañas comerciales.


¡¡Y muchas más cosas!!


¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?


Iveco apuesta por la formación, tanto práctica como académica. Es por ello que ponemos a tu disposición la posibilidad de participar en nuestro programa de Beca. Nosotros nos encargamos del convenio de colaboración; tu solo tienes que preocuparte por tu desarrollo personal (académico y profesional). Con esta visión ofrecemos:


  • Inscripción a cargo de la Compañía en el programa Universitario o de Postgrado de nuestro catálogo durante 18 meses.
  • Beca de ayuda mensual al estudio por importe de 1100 euros brutos.
  • Horario de prácticas: 35 horas semanales, repartidas de lunes a jueves de 08:00 a 16:00 h y los viernes de 8:00 a 14:00
  • Flexibilidad horaria de 2 horas.
  • Posibilidad de teletrabajo.
  • Atractivo calendario laboral.
  • Comedor de Empresa sin coste.


¿ Que estamos buscando?


  • Haber finalizado o a estar cerca de finalizar tu formación universitaria.
  • Inglés: nivel medio real tanto oral como escrito (se realizará prueba).
  • Excel; nivel medio-alto (se realizará prueba).


"Iveco is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We don’t discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status."

Title: Addetto/a accoglienza clienti e gestione crediti – settore finanziario
HTML:
Azienda operante nel settore dei servizi finanziari seleziona una risorsa da inserire nel team per attività di accoglienza clienti e gestione delle pratiche di recupero crediti.

La figura sarà inserita in un contesto strutturato, con un periodo di formazione retribuita, e si interfaccerà quotidianamente con l’utenza e i referenti aziendali per l’organizzazione delle attività amministrative.

Attività:

accoglienza e assistenza clienti presso gli uffici aziendali;

supporto alle attività di gestione e recupero crediti;

contatti telefonici e gestione pratiche amministrative;

aggiornamento delle anagrafiche e degli archivi informatici.

Requisiti richiesti:

diploma di maturità;

buone capacità comunicative e relazionali;

disponibilità immediata;

gradita esperienza in ruoli analoghi (accoglienza, front office, call center), ma si valutano anche profili junior.

Offerta:

contratto a tempo determinato full time;

formazione iniziale retribuita;

buoni pasto.

Title: Data Science Consultant – Analytics Banking
Description:
NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.







¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.







Descripción de la oferta: NTT Data desea contratar consultores de proyectos de analítica avanzada e IA para el departamento de Business Analytics – sector banca.

Las personas candidatas deben ser capaces de obtener conclusiones de negocio a partir de grandes volúmenes de información mediante la modelización avanzada de datos.







Es necesario tener alguna experiencia probada en desarrollo de proyectos analíticos en sector financiero.







Titulación: Formación en Matemáticas, Físicas, Ingeniería, Estadística o formación similar. Se valorarán Posgrados en Inteligencia Artificial y/o Ciencia del dato.







Experiencia: 1 - 3 años de experiencia en Analítica Avanzada y ciencia del dato aplicada a servicios financieros.







Conocimientos:







Requerido:




Background analítico y de programación (Python, pyspark)
Visualización de datos con herramientas como PowerBI, Tableau, Looker o similar
Nivel Avanzado en inglés







Valorado:




ETLs (SQL, Spark DataFrames API)
Conocimiento de aplicaciones de machine Learning, Deep Learning y estadística en diferentes dominios. Conocimiento en natural language processing (NLP) y en Large Language Models (LLMs)







Deseable:




- Conocimiento de entornos de nube como Azure, GCP o AWS.

- Certificaciones en entornos de nube (Azure, AWS, GCP)







Soft skills:







Fuerte pensamiento analítico.
Buenas habilidades de comunicación.
Trabajo en equipo y colaborativo.
Toma de decisiones basada en datos.







¿Qué te ofrecemos?







Te ofrecemos la incorporación a una compañía que marca la diferencia estando cerca de nuestros clientes, superando las expectativas, gestionando proactivamente nuestros proyectos y a nuestros clientes y centrándonos en la calidad a través de la selección de los empleados con la mentalidad adecuada para asegurar nuestro crecimiento.







Más allá del alcance de tu responsabilidad directa, formarás parte de la práctica de Business Consulting en la que te encontrarás con un equipo dinámico, joven, entusiasta y siempre orientado hacia el éxito, a partir de una fuerte cultura emprendedora pero, sobre todo, de un gran ambiente de trabajo, en el que todos formamos parte de un proyecto compartido, y en el que todos somos importantes.







Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.







#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Show more

Title: Data Warehouse / Programmierer (w/m/d)
Description:
#NoHeadhunters #NoAgencies #NoFreelancers #KeinAnschreibenNotwendig #KeinFotoNotwendig




Wir suchen Verstärkung für unser IT-Team: eine Mischung aus Data-Engineer und Programmierung mit Schwerpunkt im OpenSource-Bereich in Vollzeit.




Aufgabenbereiche (Projekt 1 - Beginn 1. November 2025 für etwa 1 Jahr)

Eigenverantwortliche Einführung eines ETL/ELT-Tools und Aufbau eines Data Warehous auf Basis von Apache NiFi und PostgreSQL. Anbindung von bis zu 17 vorhandenen Systemen (von Hubspot bis Legacy) und Etablierung des Datenaustausches. Unterstützung von Key Users in Finance und Controlling bei der Interpretation von Daten, Analyse von Datenformaten und dem Umgang mit Apache NiFi. Etablierung von Datenstandards und gruppenweiten Datenformaten.




Aufgabenbereiche (Projekt 2 - voraussichtlicher Beginn Q1/2026 für etwa 2 Jahre)

Technische Unterstützung, Entwicklung von Schnittstellen, Funktionen, Prozessabbildungen bei der Konsolidierung der 17 vorhandenen Systemen auf ein gruppenweites neues System. Zusammenarbeit mit externer Firma bei der Einführung der Systeme, Verantwortung für die Datenmigration von Altsystem zu Neusystem, Dokumentation, Konzeption. Implementierung von firmenspezifischen Dashboards, Aufgabenfeldern und Anbindung von Industrieanlagen für unsere Produktion in verschiedenen europäischen Ländern.




Qualifikationen

Solide / Tiefe Erfahrungen mit Apache NiFi 2.5 oder neuer
Umfangreiche Erfahrungen im Data-Bereich (Formate, Standardisierung, Datenaustausch)
Umfangreiche Kenntnisse in python und evtl. C#
Sehr selbstständige, proaktive und schnelle Arbeitsweise
Arbeitsfähig ohne ständige Führung und Rückversicherung (nach Einarbeitung)
Teamfähig, Englisch und Deutsch in Schrift und Wort
Zukunftsorientiert, Gestaltungswillen, Diplomatie und emotionale Intelligenz
Reisebereitschaft in EU, teilweise bis zu zwei Wochen zur Klärung von technischen Fragen vor Ort
Brückenbauer und Übersetzer zwischen Anwendern und IT mit viel Fingerspitzengefühl




Wir bieten

Hybride Arbeitsweise: bis zu 90% Homeoffice nach Einarbeitung
Beginn ab 1. November 2025 oder früher
Show more
